Advanced_RAG_GPT-4o-mini: CVE-2013-3900 is a remote code execution vulnerability in the way the WinVerifyTrust function handles Windows Authenticode signature verification for portable executable (PE) files. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by modifying an existing signed executable file to include malicious code without invalidating the signature, potentially taking complete control of an affected system. Exploitation requires that a user or application runs or installs a specially crafted, signed PE file.

CVE-2013-6040 refers to a vulnerability in the MW6 Aztec, DataMatrix, and MaxiCode ActiveX controls before version 4.0. These controls are vulnerable to arbitrary code execution via a crafted HTML document. The issue has been resolved in the latest version, 4.0, of these ActiveX controls.

CVE-2015-10123 describes a vulnerability where an unauthenticated remote attacker could send specifically crafted packets to an affected device. If an authenticated user then views that data in a specific page of the web-based management, a buffer overflow will be triggered, allowing the attacker to gain full access to the device.

CVE-2017-12741 involves a denial of service vulnerability where specially crafted packets sent to port 161/udp could cause a denial of service condition. The affected devices must be restarted manually to recover from this condition.

CVE-2017-2681 is a vulnerability where specially crafted PROFINET DCP packets sent on a local Ethernet segment (Layer 2) to an affected product could cause a denial of service condition of that product. Human interaction is required to recover the system. This vulnerability does not affect PROFIBUS interfaces.

CVE-2019-0720 is a remote code execution vulnerability that exists when Windows Hyper-V Network Switch on a host server fails to properly validate input from an authenticated user on a guest operating system. An attacker exploiting this vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a guest operating system, which could cause the Hyper-V host operating system to execute arbitrary code. The security update for this vulnerability addresses the issue by correcting how Windows Hyper-V Network Switch validates guest operating system network traffic.

CVE-2019-0965 is a remote code execution vulnerability that exists when Windows Hyper-V on a host server fails to properly validate input from an authenticated user on a guest operating system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by running a specially crafted application on a guest operating system, which could cause the Hyper-V host operating system to execute arbitrary code. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Hyper-V validates guest operating system user input.

CVE-2019-1057 is a remote code execution vulnerability where the Microsoft XML Core Services MSXML parser processes user input. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability could run malicious code remotely to take control of the user’s system. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker could host a specially crafted website designed to invoke MSXML through a web browser. However, an attacker would typically have to convince a user to either click a link in an email message or instant message to visit such a website. The vulnerability is addressed by correcting how the MSXML parser processes user input.

CVE-2019-10923 is a vulnerability where an attacker with network access to an affected product may cause a denial of service condition by breaking the real-time synchronization (IRT) of the affected installation.

CVE-2019-10936 is a vulnerability where affected devices improperly handle large amounts of specially crafted UDP packets. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger a denial of service condition.

CVE-2019-1133 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Internet Explorer's scripting engine. The vulnerability arises from the improper handling of objects in memory, potentially allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code with the same user rights as the current user. Successful exploitation enables the attacker to install programs, manipulate data, or create accounts with full user rights. In web-based attacks, the attacker might host a specially crafted website and entrap users to view it using Internet Explorer, or by embedding ActiveX controls marked "safe for initialization" in applications or documents using the IE rendering engine. The security update mitigates the vulnerability by altering how the scripting engine handles objects in memory.

CVE-2019-1140 is a remote code execution vulnerability that exists in the way the Chakra scripting engine handles objects in memory in Microsoft Edge (HTML-based). If successfully exploited, an attacker could corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, potentially gaining the same user rights as the current user. If the current user has administrative rights, the attacker could take control of the affected system, allowing them to install programs, view or modify data, or create new accounts with full user rights. The vulnerability can be exploited through a specially crafted website that the user is convinced to visit. The security update addresses this vulnerability by modifying how the Chakra scripting engine handles objects in memory.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how DHCP failover servers handle network packets.

CVE-2019-13939 is a vulnerability identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303), Nucleus NET (all versions), Nucleus ReadyStart V3 (all versions < V2017.02.3), and Nucleus Source Code (all versions). An attacker could change the IP address of the device to an invalid value by sending specially crafted DHCP packets to a device where the DHCP client is enabled.

CVE-2019-18338 is a vulnerability identified in Control Center Server (CCS) versions prior to V1.5.0. It involves a directory traversal vulnerability in the XML-based communication protocol, provided by default on ports 5444/tcp and 5440/tcp. An authenticated remote attacker with network access to the CCS server could exploit this vulnerability to list arbitrary directories or read files outside of the CCS application context.

CVE-2019-19292 is a vulnerability in Control Center Server (CCS) (all versions < V1.5.0) that involves an SQL injection vulnerability in its XML-based communication protocol on ports 5444/tcp and 5440/tcp. An authenticated remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read or modify the CCS database and potentially execute administrative database operations or operating system commands.

CVE-2019-19297 is a vulnerability identified in SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server (all versions prior to V5.0.0). The streaming service on the default port 5410/tcp of the SiVMS/SiNVR Video Server has a path traversal vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to access and download arbitrary files from the server.

CVE-2019-19298 is a vulnerability identified in the SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server for all versions from V5.0.0 up to but not including V5.0.2. The streaming service on the default port 5410/tcp contains an input validation vulnerability. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause a Denial-of-Service condition by sending malformed HTTP requests.

CVE-2019-19299 is a vulnerability identified in the SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server (all versions between V5.0.0 and V5.0.2). The streaming service (default port 5410/tcp) of the SiVMS/SiNVR Video Server applies weak cryptography when exposing device (camera) passwords. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to read and decrypt the passwords and conduct further attacks.

CVE-2019-20925 describes a vulnerability wherein an unauthenticated client can trigger a denial of service by sending specially crafted wire protocol messages. These messages cause the message decompressor in MongoDB Server to incorrectly allocate memory. The affected versions include MongoDB Server v4.2 versions prior to 4.2.1, v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.13, v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.15, and v3.4 versions prior to 3.4.24.

CVE-2019-2386 is an issue in MongoDB Server where the improper invalidation of authorization sessions allows an authenticated user's session to persist and become conflated with new accounts if those accounts reuse the names of deleted ones. It affects MongoDB Server versions 4.0 prior to 4.0.9, 3.6 prior to 3.6.13, and 3.4 prior to 3.4.22. To work around the issue, it is recommended to restart any nodes with active user authorization sessions after deleting users and refrain from creating new user accounts with the same name as previously deleted accounts.

CVE-2019-2390 is a vulnerability where an unprivileged user or a program on Microsoft Windows that can create OpenSSL configuration files in a fixed location may cause utility programs shipped with MongoDB server to run attacker-defined code as the user running the utility. This issue affects MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.11, v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.14, and v3.4 prior to 3.4.22.

CVE-2019-5638 refers to a vulnerability in Rapid7 Nexpose versions 6.5.50 and prior. It involves insufficient session expiration when an administrator performs a security-relevant edit on an existing, logged-on user. If a user's password is changed by an administrator due to an unrelated credential leak, the user's current session remains valid post-password change. This could potentially allow an attacker with the compromised credential to stay logged in and cause further damage.

CVE-2020-0604 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Visual Studio Code that arises when it processes environment variables after opening a project. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a target to clone a repository and open it in Visual Studio Code. The attacker-specified code would execute when the target opened the integrated terminal. If exploited successfully, the attacker could run arbitrary code in the context of the current user and potentially take control of the affected system. The vulnerability is addressed by modifying how Visual Studio Code handles environment variables.

An authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request, which could allow them to perform cross-site scripting attacks on affected systems. This could enable the attacker to read unauthorized content, use the victim's identity to take actions on the SharePoint site on behalf of the victim, change permissions, delete content, steal sensitive information (such as browser cookies), and inject malicious content into the victim's browser. To exploit the vulnerability, a user must click a specially crafted URL that directs them to a targeted SharePoint Web App site. The security update addresses the vulnerability by ensuring proper sanitization of web requests in SharePoint Server.

CVE-2020-16945 is a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint Server. This vulnerability exists because the server does not properly sanitize specially crafted web requests. An authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to an affected SharePoint server, enabling them to perform cross-site scripting attacks on affected systems and run scripts in the security context of the current user. Successful exploitation could allow the attacker to read unauthorized content, use the victim's identity on the SharePoint site, change permissions, delete content, and inject malicious content in the user's browser. The security update addresses this vulnerability by ensuring that SharePoint Server properly sanitizes web requests.

CVE-2020-16946 is a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint Server. The vulnerability arises when the server does not properly sanitize a specially crafted web request. An authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to an affected SharePoint server, enabling the attacker to perform cross-site scripting attacks on affected systems. This could allow the attacker to read unauthorized content, use the victim's identity to perform actions on the SharePoint site, change permissions, delete content, and inject malicious content into the user's browser. The security update is designed to ensure that SharePoint Server properly sanitizes web requests.

CVE-2020-16947 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Outlook software. It occurs when the software fails to properly handle objects in memory. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to run arbitrary code in the context of the targeted user. If the targeted user has administrative user rights, the attacker could take control of the affected system, allowing them to install programs, view, change, or delete data, or create new accounts with full user rights. Exploitation requires the user to open a specially crafted file with an affected version of Microsoft Outlook. In email and web-based attack scenarios, the attacker must convince the user to open the specially crafted file. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Outlook handles objects in memory.

CVE-2020-16951 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint. It occurs when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the SharePoint application pool and server farm account. Exploiting this vulnerability requires an attacker to upload a specially crafted SharePoint application package to an affected version of SharePoint. The security update addresses the vulnerability by fixing how SharePoint checks the source markup of application packages.

CVE-2020-16952 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint. This vulnerability arises when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package. If successfully exploited, an attacker could run arbitrary code in the context of the SharePoint application pool and the SharePoint server farm account. Exploiting this vulnerability requires a user to upload a specially crafted SharePoint application package to an affected version of SharePoint. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how SharePoint checks the source markup of application packages.

CVE-2020-16954 is a remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Office software that occurs when the software fails to properly handle objects in memory. An attacker who exploits this vulnerability can run arbitrary code in the context of the current user, potentially taking control of the affected system if the user has administrative rights. Exploitation requires opening a specially crafted file with an affected version of Microsoft Office. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Microsoft Office handles objects in memory.

CVE-2020-16955 is an elevation of privilege vulnerability in the way that Microsoft Office Click-to-Run (C2R) AppVLP handles certain files. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could elevate privileges by convincing a user to open a specially crafted file.
