CVE-2020-24682 is an "Unquoted Search Path or Element" vulnerability in B&R Industrial Automation's Automation Studio and NET/PVI. This vulnerability allows target programs to have elevated privileges. It affects the following versions:- Automation Studio: from 4.0 through 4.6, from 4.7.0 before 4.7.7 SP, from 4.8.0 before 4.8.6 SP, from 4.9.0 before 4.9.4 SP.- NET/PVI: from 4.0 through 4.6, from 4.7.0 before 4.7.7, from 4.8.0 before 4.8.6, from 4.9.0 before 4.9.4.

CVE-2020-26732 is a vulnerability in SKYWORTH GN542VF Hardware Version 2.0 and Software Version 2.0.0.16, where the Secure flag for the session cookie in an HTTPS session is not set. This makes it easier for remote attackers to capture this cookie by intercepting its transmission within an HTTP session.

CVE-2020-28400 is a vulnerability in affected devices that allows an unauthenticated attacker to trigger a denial of service condition. This vulnerability can be exploited if a large amount of DCP reset packets are sent to the device.

CVE-2020-3920 refers to a vulnerability in the UltraLog Express device management interface. It does not properly perform access authentication in some specific pages/functions, allowing any user to access a privileged page to manage accounts through a specific system directory.

CVE-2020-3921 refers to a vulnerability in the UltraLog Express device management software, where user information is stored in cleartext. This allows any user to obtain account information through a specific page.

CVE-2020-5245 is a vulnerability in Dropwizard-Validation versions before 1.3.19 and 2.0.2, which may allow arbitrary code execution on the host system with the privileges of the Dropwizard service account. This can be exploited by injecting arbitrary Java Expression Language expressions when using the self-validating feature. The issue has been fixed in dropwizard-validation versions 1.3.19 and 2.0.2.

CVE-2020-5367 is an improper certificate validation vulnerability found in Dell EMC Unisphere for PowerMax versions prior to 9.1.0.17, Dell EMC Unisphere for PowerMax Virtual Appliance versions prior to 9.1.0.17, and PowerMax OS Release 5978. An unauthenticated remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability to carry out a man-in-the-middle attack by supplying a crafted certificate, intercepting the victim's traffic, and potentially viewing or modifying the victim's data in transit.

CVE-2020-7925 refers to a vulnerability involving incorrect validation of user input in the role name parser of MongoDB Server. This issue may lead to the use of uninitialized memory, allowing an unauthenticated attacker to use a specially crafted request to cause a denial of service. This vulnerability affects MongoDB Server v4.4 versions prior to 4.4.0-rc12 and MongoDB Server v4.2 versions prior to 4.2.9.
The context provided does not contain information about CVE-2020-7927.

CVE-2021-1638 is an "Impersonation in the Passkey Entry Protocol" vulnerability. Microsoft is aware of this vulnerability and has released a software update to address it. The update will prevent pairing attempts if the remote device exchanges a public key with the same X coordinate as the locally exchanged public key. More information about the vulnerability can be found in a statement from the Bluetooth SIG.

CVE-2021-21551 is a vulnerability in the Dell dbutil_2_3.sys driver that contains insufficient access control. This vulnerability may lead to escalation of privileges, denial of service, or information disclosure. Local authenticated user access is required to exploit this vulnerability.

CVE-2021-22280 is a vulnerability involving improper DLL loading algorithms in B&R Automation Studio versions >=4.0 and <4.12, which may allow an authenticated local attacker to execute code in the context of the product.

CVE-2021-22282 is an "Improper Control of Generation of Code" ('Code Injection') vulnerability in B&R Industrial Automation's Automation Studio. This vulnerability allows for local execution of code and affects versions from 4.0 through 4.12 of Automation Studio.

CVE-2021-25663 is a vulnerability identified in several products including Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303), Nucleus NET (all versions), Nucleus ReadyStart V3 (all versions < V2017.02.4), Nucleus ReadyStart V4 (all versions < V4.1.0), and Nucleus Source Code (all versions including affected IPv6 stack). The vulnerability exists because the function that processes IPv6 headers does not check the lengths of extension header options, which allows attackers to put this function into an infinite loop using crafted length values.

CVE-2021-25664 is a vulnerability identified in several products including Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422, Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions prior to V2303), Nucleus NET (all versions), Nucleus ReadyStart V3 (all versions prior to V2017.02.4), Nucleus ReadyStart V4 (all versions prior to V4.1.0), and Nucleus Source Code (all versions including those affected by the IPv6 stack). The vulnerability lies in the function that processes the Hop-by-Hop extension header in IPv6 packets and its options, which lacks checks against the length field of the header. This deficiency allows attackers to place the function into an infinite loop by providing arbitrary length values.

CVE-2021-31345 is a vulnerability identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303), and PLUSCONTROL 1st Gen (all versions). The issue is that the total length of a UDP payload, as set in the IP header, is unchecked. This can lead to various side effects, including information leaks and denial-of-service conditions, depending on the user-defined applications that run on top of the UDP protocol.

CVE-2021-31346 is a vulnerability identified in several products, including Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303), PLUSCONTROL 1st Gen (all versions), and SIMOTICS CONNECT 400 (all versions < V0.5.0.0 and all versions < V1.0.0.0). The issue is that the total length of an ICMP payload set in the IP header is unchecked, which may lead to various side effects such as Information Leak and Denial-of-Service conditions depending on the network buffer organization in memory.

CVE-2021-31881 is a vulnerability identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions) and Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303). The vulnerability occurs when processing a DHCP OFFER message; the DHCP client application does not validate the length of the Vendor options, which can lead to Denial-of-Service conditions.

CVE-2021-31883 is a vulnerability identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions) and Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303). This vulnerability occurs when processing a DHCP ACK message, where the DHCP client application fails to validate the length of the Vendor options, leading to Denial-of-Service conditions.

CVE-2021-31889 is a vulnerability identified in the following products: Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (all versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (all versions < V2303), PLUSCONTROL 1st Gen (all versions), and SIMOTICS CONNECT 400 (all versions < V0.5.0.0). The vulnerability arises from malformed TCP packets with a corrupted SACK option, leading to information leaks and Denial-of-Service conditions.

CVE-2021-31890 is a vulnerability identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (All versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (All versions < V2303), PLUSCONTROL 1st Gen (All versions), and SIMOTICS CONNECT 400 (All versions < V0.5.0.0 and < V1.0.0.0). The vulnerability involves the total length of a TCP payload (set in the IP header) being unchecked, which may lead to information leaks and denial-of-service conditions, depending on the network buffer organization in memory.

CVE-2021-33141 refers to a vulnerability related to improper input validation in some Intel(R) Ethernet Adapters and Intel(R) Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware. It may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.

CVE-2021-33145 refers to an "Uncaught exception in some Intel(R) Ethernet Adapters and Intel(R) Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware." This vulnerability may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2021-33157 refers to an insufficient control flow management vulnerability in some Intel® Ethernet Adapters and Intel® Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware. This vulnerability may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2021-33158 refers to an improper neutralization vulnerability in some Intel(R) Ethernet Adapters and Intel(R) Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware. This vulnerability may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2021-33161 is an issue with improper input validation in some Intel(R) Ethernet Adapters and Intel(R) Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware. This vulnerability may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2021-33162 refers to an issue of improper access control in some Intel(R) Ethernet Adapters and Intel(R) Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware. This vulnerability may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2021-34600 is a vulnerability in Telenot CompasX versions prior to 32.0, which use a weak seed for random number generation. This leads to predictable AES keys used in the NFC tags for local authorization of users, potentially resulting in a total loss of trustworthiness of the installation.

CVE-2021-35234 relates to a vulnerability in Orion Core that allows for read-only SQL injection, leading to privilege escalation. An attacker with low-user privileges may steal password hashes and password salt information.

CVE-2021-35250 is a Directory Transversal Vulnerability reported in Serv-U 15.3. It potentially allows access to files relating to the Serv-U installation and server files. This issue has been resolved in Serv-U 15.3 Hotfix 1.

CVE-2021-36821 is an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation vulnerability, also known as Cross-site Scripting (XSS), in WPMU DEV Forminator. It allows Stored XSS, affecting Forminator versions from n/a through 1.14.11.
CVE-2021-38578 refers to a vulnerability where existing CommBuffer checks in SmmEntryPoint fail to catch underflow when computing BufferSize.

CVE-2021-3958 refers to an improper handling of parameters vulnerability in Ipack Automation Systems' Ipack SCADA Software, which allows for blind SQL injection. This issue affects Ipack SCADA Software versions unspecified before 1.1.0.

CVE-2021-41372 is a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) and Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Power BI Report Server. It occurs when a Power BI Report Server Template file (pbix) containing HTML files is uploaded to the server and accessed directly by the victim. By combining these two vulnerabilities, an attacker can upload malicious Power BI template files using the victim's session, execute scripts in the security context of the user, and potentially perform privilege escalation if the victim has admin privileges when accessing one of the embedded HTML files. The security update addresses this vulnerability by ensuring that Power BI Report Server properly sanitizes file uploads.
CVE-2021-42083 is a vulnerability that allows an authenticated attacker to create alerts that trigger a stored XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) attack.

CVE-2021-42306 is an information disclosure vulnerability that occurs when a user or an application uploads unprotected private key data as part of an authentication certificate keyCredential on an Azure AD Application or Service Principal, which is not recommended. This vulnerability enables a user or service in the tenant with application read access to read the private key data that was added to the application. Azure AD addressed this vulnerability by preventing disclosure of any private key values added to the application.

CVE-2021-42362 relates to a vulnerability in the WordPress Popular Posts WordPress plugin. This vulnerability allows for arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient input file type validation in the ~/src/Image.php file. Attackers with contributor level access and above can exploit this to upload malicious files, which could be used to achieve remote code execution. The affected versions are up to and including version 5.3.2.

CVE-2021-43890 refers to a spoofing vulnerability in the AppX installer affecting Microsoft Windows. Microsoft is aware of attacks exploiting this vulnerability by using specially crafted packages associated with the malware family known as Emotet/Trickbot/Bazaloader. The attacker could utilize phishing campaigns to deliver a malicious attachment requiring user interaction to exploit the vulnerability. Users with limited user rights may experience reduced impact compared to users with administrative rights. Microsoft issued updates, including disabling the "ms-appinstaller" protocol by default, to address increased activity from threat actors exploiting this vulnerability.

CVE-2021-44793 refers to a vulnerability in Single Connect where an authorization check is not performed when using the "sc-reports-ui" module. This flaw can be exploited by a remote attacker to access the device configuration page and export data to an external file, potentially leading to the acquisition of sensitive information, including database credentials. Since the database operates with high privileges, it can allow the execution of commands with the obtained credentials.
CVE-2021-45031 is a vulnerability in MEPSAN's USC+ software version before 3.0, which has a weakness in its login function that allows attackers to generate passwords for high privileged accounts.

CVE-2021-45036 refers to a vulnerability in Velneo vClient version 28.1.3, where an attacker with knowledge of the victim's username and hashed password could spoof the victim's identity against the server.

CVE-2022-1119 is a vulnerability in the Simple File List WordPress plugin that is susceptible to Arbitrary File Download via the eeFile parameter found in the ~/includes/ee-downloader.php file. This vulnerability is due to missing controls, which allows unauthenticated attackers to supply a path to a file that will subsequently be downloaded. This issue affects versions of the plugin up to and including 3.2.7.

CVE-2022-21952 is a Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in spacewalk-java of SUSE Manager Server 4.1 and SUSE Manager Server 4.2. It allows remote attackers to easily exhaust available disk resources, which can lead to a Denial of Service (DoS). This issue affects SUSE Manager Server 4.1 spacewalk-java versions prior to 4.1.46 and SUSE Manager Server 4.2 spacewalk-java versions prior to 4.2.37.

CVE-2022-22521 is a vulnerability found in Miele Benchmark Programming Tool versions prior to 1.2.71. This issue allows executable files manipulated by attackers to be unknowingly executed with user privileges. An attacker with low privileges may trick a user with administrative privileges into executing these binaries as an admin.

CVE-2022-22549 is an improper certificate validation vulnerability found in Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x to 9.3.x. An unauthenticated remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to a man-in-the-middle capture of administrative credentials.

CVE-2022-2265 is an unauthenticated Path traversal vulnerability in the Identity and Directory Management System developed by Çekino Bilgi Teknolojileri, affecting versions before 2.1.25. This vulnerability has been fixed in version 2.1.25.

CVE-2022-23820 refers to a vulnerability where there is a failure to validate the AMD SMM communication buffer. This vulnerability may allow an attacker to corrupt the SMRAM, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

CVE-2022-24036 refers to a vulnerability in Karmasis Informatics Infraskope SIEM+ that allows for unauthenticated access. An attacker exploiting this vulnerability could modify logs without authentication.
CVE-2022-24037 refers to a vulnerability in Karmasis Informatics Infraskope SIEM+, where an unauthenticated attacker could obtain critical information due to an unauthenticated access vulnerability.

Based on the provided context, CVE-2022-2442 refers to a vulnerability in the Migration, Backup, Staging – WPvivid plugin for WordPress. This vulnerability involves the deserialization of untrusted input via the 'path' parameter in versions up to and including 0.9.74. This flaw allows authenticated attackers with administrative privileges to call files using a PHAR wrapper that will deserialize and call arbitrary PHP objects, potentially enabling a variety of malicious actions, provided a POP chain is present. It additionally requires successful file upload with a serialized payload by the attacker.

CVE-2022-2513 is a vulnerability in the Intelligent Electronic Device (IED) Connectivity Package (ConnPack) credential storage function in Hitachi Energy’s PCM600 product. The vulnerability arises because IED credentials are stored in cleartext format in the PCM600 database and log files. An attacker with access to the exported backup file can exploit this vulnerability to obtain user credentials of the IEDs. Additionally, an attacker with administrator access to the PCM600 host machine can obtain other user credentials by analyzing database log files, which can then be used to perform unauthorized modifications such as loading incorrect configurations, rebooting the IEDs, or causing a denial-of-service on the IEDs.

CVE-2022-25153 is a vulnerability in the ITarian Endpoint Manage Communication Client, prior to version 6.43.41148.21120, which is compiled using insecure OpenSSL settings. This vulnerability allows a malicious actor with low privileges access to a system to escalate their privileges to SYSTEM by abusing an insecure openssl.conf lookup.

CVE-2022-2717 is a vulnerability in the JoomSport plugin for WordPress, specifically affecting versions up to and including 5.2.5. It is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'orderby' parameter on the joomsport-events-form page. The issue arises due to insufficient escaping on the user-supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with administrative privileges to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries, which can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

CVE-2022-2718 is a vulnerability in the JoomSport plugin for WordPress, which affects versions up to and including 5.2.5. It is an SQL Injection vulnerability via the 'orderby' parameter on the joomsport-page-extrafields page. This vulnerability is due to insufficient escaping of user-supplied parameters and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. Authenticated attackers with administrative privileges can exploit this to append additional SQL queries into existing queries, potentially extracting sensitive information from the database.
CVE-2022-27858 refers to a CSV Injection vulnerability in the Activity Log plugin (version 2.8.3 or earlier) for WordPress.

CVE-2022-2808 is an Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key vulnerability in Algan Software's Prens Student Information System that allows for Object Relational Mapping Injection. This issue affects versions of Prens Student Information System before 2.1.11.

CVE-2022-28613 is a vulnerability in the HCI Modbus TCP function included in certain product versions. When the HCI Modbus TCP is enabled and configured, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted message to the RTU500, causing it to reboot. The issue arises from a validation error in the length information within the MBAP header of the HCI Modbus TCP function.
CVE-2022-29149 is an "Open Management Infrastructure (OMI) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability."

CVE-2022-30190 is a remote code execution vulnerability that exists when Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT) is called using the URL protocol from a calling application such as Word. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability can run arbitrary code with the privileges of the calling application. This could allow the attacker to install programs, view, change, or delete data, or create new accounts within the context allowed by the user's rights. For more information on protection measures, please refer to the MSRC Blog Entry.

CVE-2022-31216 is a vulnerability in the Drive Composer software that allows a low privileged attacker to create and write to a file anywhere on the file system as SYSTEM with arbitrary content, as long as the file does not already exist. The vulnerability is related to the Drive Composer installer file, which permits a low-privileged user to run a "repair" operation on the product.

CVE-2022-31217 is a vulnerability in the Drive Composer that allows a low privileged attacker to create and write to a file anywhere on the file system as SYSTEM with arbitrary content, as long as the file does not already exist. The vulnerability occurs because the Drive Composer installer file allows a low-privileged user to run a "repair" operation on the product.

CVE-2022-31218 refers to vulnerabilities in the Drive Composer that allow a low privileged attacker to create and write to a file anywhere on the file system as SYSTEM with arbitrary content, provided the file does not already exist. The vulnerability is present as the Drive Composer installer file permits a low-privileged user to run a "repair" operation on the product.
I am sorry, but the provided context does not contain any information about CVE-2022-31219.

CVE-2022-31474 is an Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in iThemes BackupBuddy, which allows Path Traversal. This issue affects BackupBuddy from version 8.5.8.0 through 8.7.4.1.

CVE-2022-31805 refers to a vulnerability in the CODESYS Development System. Multiple components in multiple versions of the system transmit passwords for communication between clients and servers without protection.

CVE-2022-32455 refers to a vulnerability in BIG-IP versions, specifically in Versions 16.1.x before 16.1.2.2, 15.1.x before 15.1.6.1, 14.1.x before 14.1.5, and all versions of 13.1.x. When a BIG-IP LTM Client SSL profile is configured on a virtual server to perform client certificate authentication with session tickets enabled, certain undisclosed requests cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate. Note that software versions that have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated for this vulnerability.

CVE-2022-33162 is a security vulnerability in IBM Security Directory Integrator 7.2.0 and Security Verify Directory Integrator 10.0.0. These versions do not perform authentication for functionality that requires a provable user identity or consumes a significant amount of resources at the privilege level of a standard unprivileged user. The vulnerability is identified by IBM X-Force ID: 228570.

CVE-2022-33324 is an Improper Resource Shutdown or Release vulnerability in Mitsubishi Electric Corporation's MELSEC iQ-R Series and MELIPC Series products. This vulnerability affects specific firmware versions of these products:- MELSEC iQ-R Series R00/01/02CPU Firmware versions "32" and prior- MELSEC iQ-R Series R04/08/16/32/120(EN)CPU Firmware versions "65" and prior- MELSEC iQ-R Series R08/16/32/120SFCPU Firmware versions "29" and prior- MELSEC iQ-R Series R08/16/32/120PSFCPU Firmware versions "08" and prior- MELSEC iQ-R Series R12CCPU-V Firmware versions "17" and prior- MELSEC iQ-L Series L04/08/16/32HCPU Firmware versions "05" and prior- MELIPC Series MI5122-VW Firmware versions "07" and priorThe vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition in Ethernet communication on the module by sending specially crafted packets. Recovery from this issue requires a system reset of the module.

CVE-2022-3369 is an Improper Access Control vulnerability in the `bdservicehost.exe` component used in Bitdefender Engines for Windows. This vulnerability allows an attacker to delete privileged registry keys by pointing a Registry symlink to a privileged key. It affects various Bitdefender products, including Antivirus Free, Antivirus Plus, Internet Security, Total Security, and Endpoint Security Tools for Windows, all using engine versions prior to 7.92659.
CVE-2022-34149 is an Authentication Bypass vulnerability in the miniOrange WP OAuth Server plugin for WordPress, affecting versions up to and including 3.0.4.

CVE-2022-34965 is a vulnerability in OpenTeknik LLC OSSN OPEN SOURCE SOCIAL NETWORK v6.3 LTS. It involves an arbitrary file upload vulnerability via the component /ossn/administrator/com_installer. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PHP file. Note: The project owner believes this is intended behavior of the application as it only allows authenticated admins to upload files.

CVE-2022-36362 is a vulnerability identified in several models of LOGO! and SIPLUS LOGO! devices. These devices do not conduct certain validations when interacting with them. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to manipulate the devices' IP addresses, making the devices unreachable and necessitating a power cycle to recover them.

CVE-2022-36960 is a vulnerability in the SolarWinds Platform related to improper input validation. This vulnerability allows a remote adversary with valid access to the SolarWinds Web Console to escalate user privileges.

CVE-2022-36961 is a vulnerability in a component of the Orion Platform, which is susceptible to SQL Injection. An authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability for privilege escalation or remote code execution.

CVE-2022-36965 is a vulnerability related to insufficient sanitization of inputs in the QoE application input field, which could lead to stored and DOM-based XSS attacks. This issue was fixed and the fix was released in SolarWinds Platform (2022.3.0).
I'm sorry, but the context provided does not include information about CVE-2022-3703.

CVE-2022-38371 is a vulnerability identified in a range of devices, including APOGEE MBC (PPC) (BACnet), APOGEE MEC (PPC) (BACnet), APOGEE PXC Compact (BACnet), Desigo PXC00-U, and others. The issue arises from the FTP server not properly releasing memory resources reserved for incomplete connection attempts by FTP clients. This vulnerability could potentially allow a remote attacker to generate a denial of service condition on devices that incorporate a vulnerable version of the FTP server.

CVE-2022-42784 is a vulnerability identified in various versions of Siemens LOGO! and SIPLUS LOGO! devices. The affected devices are vulnerable to an electromagnetic fault injection, which could allow an attacker to dump and debug the firmware, manipulate memory, and potentially inject public keys of custom-created key pairs signed by the product CA. This could lead to the generation of a custom certificate, allowing communication with and impersonation of any device of the same version.
CVE-2022-43279 is a SQL injection vulnerability discovered in LimeSurvey versions before v5.0.4 via the component /application/views/themeOptions/update.php.

CVE-2022-43398 is a vulnerability identified in POWER METER SICAM Q100 (all versions prior to V2.50). Affected devices do not renew the session cookie after login/logout and also accept user-defined session cookies. This vulnerability allows an attacker to overwrite the stored session cookie of a user, and after the victim logs in, the attacker is given access to the user's account through the activated session.

CVE-2022-43513 is a vulnerability identified in Automation License Manager V5 (all versions), Automation License Manager V6 (all versions < V6.0 SP9 Upd4), and TeleControl Server Basic V3 (all versions < V3.1.2). The affected components allow for the renaming of license files with user-chosen input without authentication. This vulnerability could enable an unauthenticated remote attacker to rename and move files as a SYSTEM user.

CVE-2022-43514 is a vulnerability identified in Automation License Manager V5 (all versions), Automation License Manager V6 (all versions < V6.0 SP9 Upd4), and TeleControl Server Basic V3 (all versions < V3.1.2). The vulnerability arises from the affected component not correctly validating the root path on folder-related operations, allowing modification of files and folders outside the intended root directory. This could enable an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute file operations on files outside of the specified root folder. When chained with CVE-2022-43513, this could allow Remote Code Execution.

CVE-2022-43716 is a vulnerability identified in certain SIMATIC and SIPLUS products that can lead to a denial of service condition. This vulnerability affects components with versions lower than specified updates, such as SIMATIC CP 1242-7 V2, SIMATIC CP 1243-1, and others as listed. The affected products' webservers have a flaw that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service situation, leading to a restart of the webserver.

CVE-2022-43747 refers to a vulnerability in the baramundi Management Agent (bMA) in baramundi Management Suite (bMS) versions 2021 R1 and R2, and 2022 R1, which allows for remote code execution. This vulnerability has been addressed in security update S-2022-01, which includes fixed bMA setup files for these versions, and it is also fixed in baramundi Management Suite 2022 R2.

CVE-2022-43767 is a vulnerability identified in multiple versions of Siemens SIMATIC communication processors, including various models and versions as specified in the context. The vulnerability exists in the webserver of the affected products and may lead to a denial of service condition. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service situation of the webserver on the affected product.

CVE-2022-43768 is a vulnerability identified in various versions of Siemens SIMATIC CP products, where the webserver of the affected products contains a vulnerability that may lead to a denial of service condition. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service situation on the webserver of the affected product.

CVE-2022-45052 is a Local File Inclusion vulnerability found in Axiell Iguana CMS. This vulnerability arises from insufficient neutralization of user input on the URL parameter in the Proxy.type.php endpoint, allowing external users to access files on the server.

CVE-2022-45794 is a vulnerability wherein an attacker with network access to the affected PLC (CJ-series and CS-series PLCs, all versions) may use a network protocol to read and write files on the PLC internal memory and memory card.

CVE-2022-45868 refers to a potential security issue in the H2 Database Engine's web-based admin console. Before version 2.2.220, the admin console can be started via the command line interface (CLI) with the argument `-webAdminPassword`, allowing the password to be specified in cleartext. This could enable a local user, or an attacker with local access, to discover the password by listing processes and their arguments. While the vendor argues that this is not a vulnerability due to the expectation that passwords should not be passed on the command line, the issue has been addressed in version 2.2.220.
CVE-2023-0383 is a vulnerability in M-Files Server before version 23.4.12528.1, where user-controlled operations could have allowed a Denial of Service due to uncontrolled memory consumption.

CVE-2023-0635 is an Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in ABB Ltd. ASPECT®-Enterprise, ABB Ltd. NEXUS Series, and ABB Ltd. MATRIX Series on Linux. This vulnerability allows for privilege escalation and affects ASPECT®-Enterprise, NEXUS Series, and MATRIX Series from version 3.0;0 before version 3.07.01.

CVE-2023-0636 is an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in ABB Ltd. ASPECT®-Enterprise and related Linux modules. This vulnerability allows for command injection and affects multiple series and versions of the product, specifically:- ASPECT®-Enterprise: from version 3.0;0 before 3.07.0- NEXUS Series: from version 3.0;0 before 3.07.0- MATRIX Series: from version 3.0;0 before 3.07.1

CVE-2023-1841 is an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Honeywell MPA2 Access Panel (Web server modules). It allows XSS Using Invalid Characters, affecting all versions prior to R1.00.08.05. Honeywell has released a firmware update package MPA2 firmware R1.00.08.05 to address this vulnerability.

CVE-2023-20063 is a vulnerability in the inter-device communication mechanisms between devices running Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software and devices running Cisco Firepower Management (FMC) Software. This vulnerability allows an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root permissions on the underlying operating system of an affected device. It is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input and can be exploited by accessing the expert mode of an affected device and submitting specific commands to a connected system. A successful exploit can allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of either an FMC or FTD device, depending on their administrative privileges.

CVE-2023-21165 is a vulnerability in DevmemIntUnmapPMR of devicemem_server.c, which allows for possible arbitrary code execution due to a use-after-free issue. This could lead to a local escalation of privilege in the kernel without the need for additional execution privileges. User interaction is not required for exploitation.

CVE-2023-21351 refers to a vulnerability where, due to a logic error in the code, there is a possible background activity launch in multiple locations. This could lead to local escalation of privilege without needing additional execution privileges. Notably, user interaction is not required for exploiting this vulnerability.

CVE-2023-21406 is a vulnerability found by Ariel Harush and Roy Hodir from OTORIO in the AXIS A1001 when communicating over OSDP. It is a heap-based buffer overflow flaw in the pacsiod process, which handles OSDP communication, allowing writing outside of the allocated buffer. By appending invalid data to an OSDP message, it was possible to write data beyond the heap-allocated buffer, potentially enabling arbitrary code execution. For more information, mitigation, and affected products and software versions, please refer to the Axis security advisory.
CVE-2023-21410 is a vulnerability where user-provided input is not sanitized on the AXIS License Plate Verifier specific "api.cgi," allowing for arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2023-21411 involves a vulnerability where user input is not sanitized in the "Settings > Access Control" configuration interface, allowing for arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2023-21412 is a vulnerability where user provided input is not sanitized on the AXIS License Plate Verifier's "search.cgi," allowing for SQL injections.

CVE-2023-21416 is a vulnerability discovered by Sandro Poppi, a member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program. It was found that the VAPIX API dynamicoverlay.cgi was susceptible to a Denial-of-Service attack, allowing an attacker to block access to the overlay configuration page in the web interface of an Axis device. This vulnerability can only be exploited after authenticating with an operator- or administrator-privileged service account, though the impact remains the same for both levels. Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions to address this flaw, and further information and solutions can be found in the Axis security advisory.

CVE-2023-21417 is a vulnerability found in the VAPIX API's `manageoverlayimage.cgi` that was susceptible to path traversal attacks, allowing for file or folder deletion. This flaw can be exploited only after authenticating with an operator- or administrator-privileged service account. The impact is lower with operator service accounts and limited to non-system files compared to administrator privileges. Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for this vulnerability.

CVE-2023-21418 is a vulnerability found by Sandro Poppi, a member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program. It involves the VAPIX API irissetup.cgi, which was susceptible to path traversal attacks allowing for file deletion. This flaw can only be exploited after authenticating with an operator- or administrator-privileged service account. The impact of exploiting this vulnerability is lower with operator service accounts and limited to non-system files compared to administrator privileges. Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions to address this flaw.

CVE-2023-22378 is a blind SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC. This vulnerability arises from improper input validation in the sorting parameter, which allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application. Authenticated users can potentially extract arbitrary information from the DBMS in an uncontrolled way, alter its structure and data, and/or affect its availability.

CVE-2023-22648 is an Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in SUSE Rancher. It causes permission changes in Azure AD not to be reflected to users while they are logged in the Rancher UI. This issue affects Rancher versions from 2.6.7 up to but not including 2.7.4.
CVE-2023-2268 is a vulnerability in Plane version 0.7.1 that allows an unauthenticated attacker to view all stored server files of all users.

CVE-2023-2270 is a vulnerability in the Netskope client service, which runs with NT\SYSTEM privileges and accepts network connections from localhost to start various services and execute commands. Before version R100, the connection handling function of this service used a relative path for downloading and unzipping configuration files. This allowed local users to exploit the vulnerability to write arbitrary files at locations accessible only to higher privileged users and potentially execute code with NT\SYSTEM privileges on the end machine.

CVE-2023-22843 is a vulnerability that involves stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). An authenticated attacker with administrative access to the web management interface can inject malicious JavaScript code inside the definition of a Threat Intelligence rule. This code will be stored and can later be executed by another legitimate user viewing the details of such a rule. This vulnerability may allow an attacker to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of legitimate users and/or gather sensitive information. JavaScript injection was possible in the contents for Yara rules, while limited HTML injection has been proven for packet and STYX rules.

The CVE-2023-2325 refers to a Stored XSS Vulnerability in M-Files Classic Web versions before 23.10 and LTS Service Release Versions before 23.2 LTS SR4 and 23.8 LTS SR1, which allows an attacker to execute a script on a user's browser via a stored HTML document.

CVE-2023-23574 is a blind SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC. It is caused by improper input validation in the alerts_count component, which allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application. Authenticated users may exploit this vulnerability to extract arbitrary information from the DBMS in an uncontrolled way, alter its structure and data, and/or affect its availability.

CVE-2023-24471 is an access control vulnerability where the restrictions applied on actual assertions are not enforced in their debug functionality. An authenticated user with reduced visibility can obtain unauthorized information via the debug functionality, gaining access to data that would normally be inaccessible in the Query and Assertions functions.

CVE-2023-24477 refers to a vulnerability in some versions of the Guardian/CMC that, under certain conditions involving timing and the use of the Chrome web browser, do not always completely invalidate the user session upon logout. This can allow an authenticated local attacker to potentially gain access to the original user's session.

CVE-2023-25529 is a vulnerability found in NVIDIA DGX H100 BMC and DGX A100 BMC. The host KVM daemon in these systems contains a vulnerability where an unauthenticated attacker may cause a leak of another user’s session token by observing timing discrepancies between server responses. If successfully exploited, this vulnerability can lead to information disclosure, escalation of privileges, and data tampering.

CVE-2023-2567 is a SQL Injection vulnerability found in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC. This vulnerability is due to improper input validation in certain parameters used in the Query functionality. Authenticated users may be able to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application.

CVE-2023-25835 is a stored Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in Esri Portal for ArcGIS Enterprise Sites versions 10.8.1 – 11.1. It may allow a remote, authenticated attacker to create a crafted link that is stored in the site configuration, which, when clicked, could potentially execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the victim's browser. The privileges required to execute this attack are high, and the impact on Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability is high.

CVE-2023-25837 is a Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS Enterprise Sites versions 10.8.1 – 10.9. This vulnerability may allow a remote, authenticated attacker to create a crafted link which, when clicked by a victim, could potentially execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the target's browser. The privileges required to execute this attack are high, and the impact to Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability are rated as High.

CVE-2023-25914 is a vulnerability due to improper restriction, which allows authenticated attackers to retrieve and read system files of the underlying server through the XML interface. The information accessed can potentially lead to a full system compromise.

CVE-2023-25948 is a vulnerability that results in a server information leak of configuration data when an error is generated in response to a specially crafted message. Honeywell has provided a security notification with recommendations on upgrading and versioning to address this issue.
CVE-2023-26135 refers to a vulnerability in all versions of the package flatnest, which are prone to Prototype Pollution via the `nest()` function in the `flatnest/nest.js` file.

CVE-2023-2626 pertains to an authentication bypass vulnerability in OpenThread border router devices and implementations. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated nodes to craft radio frames using "Key ID Mode 2," a special mode with a static encryption key that bypasses security checks. As a result, arbitrary IP packets can be transmitted on the Thread network, potentially enabling an attacker to send and receive arbitrary IPv6 packets to devices on the LAN, potentially exploiting them if they lack further authentication or have network vulnerabilities typically mitigated by the home router's NAT firewall. This issue has been mitigated through an automatic update beyond the affected range.

CVE-2023-26293 is a path traversal vulnerability identified in Totally Integrated Automation Portal (TIA Portal) versions V15, V16 (all versions < V16 Update 7), V17 (all versions < V17 Update 6), and V18 (all versions < V18 Update 1). This vulnerability could allow for the creation or overwriting of arbitrary files in the engineering system. If a user is tricked into opening a malicious PC system configuration file, an attacker can exploit this to achieve arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2023-26310 is a command injection problem in the old version of the mobile phone backup app.

CVE-2023-26317 refers to a vulnerability in Xiaomi routers where an external interface can lead to command injection. This issue arises from lax filtering of responses from external interfaces, which attackers can exploit to gain access to the router by hijacking the ISP or upper-layer routing.

CVE-2023-26597 refers to a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability due to a buffer overflow in the handling of a specially crafted message received by the controller. Honeywell's security notification recommends actions on upgrading and versioning to address this issue.

CVE-2023-27323 refers to a Time-Of-Check Time-Of-Use Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability in Parallels Desktop Updater. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first be able to execute low-privileged code on the target host system to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the service to execute a file, potentially escalating privileges and executing arbitrary code in the context of the root.

CVE-2023-27324 is a vulnerability in Parallels Desktop Updater that involves improper initialization, allowing local privilege escalation. This vulnerability enables local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop by executing low-privileged code on the target host system. The issue arises from the lack of proper initialization of environment variables within the Updater service, which can be exploited to gain root privileges and execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2023-27325 is a Parallels Desktop Updater Improper Initialization Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop by exploiting a flaw within the Updater service due to the lack of proper initialization of environment variables. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root.

CVE-2023-27326 refers to a directory traversal local privilege escalation vulnerability in the Parallels Desktop Toolgate component. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop by exploiting the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path in file operations. Attackers can leverage this to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user on the host system.

CVE-2023-27332 is a vulnerability in TP-Link Archer AX21 routers, described as a "tdpServer Logging Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without requiring authentication. The flaw exists within the logging functionality of the tdpServer program, which listens on UDP port 20002. The issue arises from a lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data before it is copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer, allowing an attacker to execute code in the context of root.

CVE-2023-27346 is a TP-Link AX1800 Firmware Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of TP-Link AX1800 routers without requiring authentication. The issue arises from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data before it is copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute code with root privileges.

CVE-2023-27364 is a vulnerability in Foxit PDF Editor related to XLS file parsing, which exposes a dangerous method leading to remote code execution. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations. To exploit this vulnerability, user interaction is required where the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The flaw exists due to the lack of proper restrictions on macro-enabled documents, allowing an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2023-27365 is a vulnerability in the Foxit PDF Editor related to DOC file parsing. It is a remote code execution vulnerability that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by exploiting a dangerous method. User interaction is required, as the target must open a malicious file or visit a malicious page. The vulnerability arises from a lack of proper restrictions on macro-enabled documents, allowing attackers to execute code within the current process context.

CVE-2023-27524 is a Session Validation attack vulnerability in Apache Superset versions up to and including 2.0.1. Installations that have not modified the default configured `SECRET_KEY` as per installation instructions allow an attacker to authenticate and access unauthorized resources. This vulnerability does not affect Superset administrators who have changed the default value for the `SECRET_KEY` configuration. It is recommended that all Superset installations set a unique, secure, random `SECRET_KEY`. The `SECRET_KEY` is used to securely sign all session cookies and encrypt sensitive information in the database. It can be added to the `superset_config.py` file or set via the `SUPERSET_SECRET_KEY` environment variable.

CVE-2023-28386 is a vulnerability affecting Snap One OvrC Pro devices, versions 7.2 and prior. These devices do not validate firmware updates correctly because they only calculate the MD5 hash of the firmware instead of checking it using a private-public key mechanism. This lack of a complete PKI system for firmware signature could allow attackers to upload arbitrary firmware updates, potentially resulting in code execution.

CVE-2023-28649 is a vulnerability in the Snap One OvrC cloud platform, specifically related to the Hub device used to centralize and manage nested devices. The vulnerability allows an attacker to impersonate a hub and send device requests to claim already claimed devices. The OvrC cloud platform receives these requests but does not validate whether the devices are already managed by another user.

CVE-2023-28766 is a vulnerability identified in several SIPROTEC 5 devices from Siemens, including the 6MD85 (CP300), various communication modules, and SIPROTEC 5 Compact 7SX800 (CP050). These affected devices lack proper validation of HTTP request parameters in the hosted web service. This vulnerability can allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to send specially crafted packets that could cause a denial of service condition on the target device.

CVE-2023-28793 is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the signelf library used by Zscaler Client Connector on Linux, which allows for code injection. This issue affects Zscaler Client Connector for Linux versions before 1.3.1.6.

CVE-2023-28796 is an Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature vulnerability in the Zscaler Client Connector on Linux, which allows for code injection. This issue affects Zscaler Client Connector for Linux versions before 1.3.1.6.

CVE-2023-28799 is a vulnerability in a URL parameter during a login flow, which was susceptible to injection. An attacker could insert a malicious domain into this parameter, causing a redirect after authentication and sending the authorization token to the redirected domain.

CVE-2023-28800 is a vulnerability where the redirect URL parameter was not encoded correctly when using local accounts for administration, allowing for a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack when providing admin login.

CVE-2023-28956 relates to a vulnerability in IBM Spectrum Protect Backup-Archive Client versions 8.1.0.0 through 8.1.17.2, where a local user may be able to escalate their privileges due to improper access controls.

CVE-2023-29051 refers to a vulnerability where user-defined OXMF templates could be used to access a limited part of the internal OX App Suite Java API. The existing switch to disable the feature by default was not effective, allowing unauthorized users to discover and modify application states, including objects related to other users and contexts. The issue has been addressed to ensure the switch disabling user-generated templates works as intended, and the feature is to be removed in future product generations. There are no publicly known exploits for this vulnerability.

CVE-2023-29245 is a SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC. It arises due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of their IDS. This vulnerability may allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application by sending specially crafted malicious network packets. An attacker with extensive knowledge of the underlying system could potentially extract arbitrary information from the DBMS in an uncontrolled way, alter its structure and data, and/or impact its availability.

CVE-2023-30312 is an issue discovered in OpenWrt versions 18.06, 19.07, 21.02, 22.03, and beyond that allows off-path attackers to hijack TCP sessions. This could lead to a denial of service, impersonation of the client to the server (such as accessing files over FTP), and impersonation of the server to the client (such as delivering false information from a finance website). The vulnerability occurs because the nf_conntrack_tcp_no_window_check is true by default.

Based on the provided context, CVE-2023-30733 is a vulnerability described as a Stack-based Buffer Overflow in the HDCP trustlet, which allows local privileged attackers to perform code execution. This issue is present prior to the SMR Oct-2023 Release 1.

CVE-2023-31211 refers to an insufficient authentication flow vulnerability in Checkmk versions before 2.2.0p18, 2.1.0p38, and 2.0.0p39. This vulnerability allows an attacker to use locked credentials.
The context does not provide any information about CVE-2023-31240.
CVE-2023-31241 is a vulnerability in Snap One OvrC cloud servers, where an attacker can use a route to bypass requirements and claim devices outright.

CVE-2023-31278 is a vulnerability in Horner Automation Cscape, which lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could result in an out-of-bounds read, potentially allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2023-31341 is a vulnerability related to insufficient validation of the Input Output Control (IOCTL) input buffer in AMD μProf, which may allow an authenticated attacker to cause an out-of-bounds write. This can potentially lead to a Windows® OS crash, resulting in a denial of service.
CVE-2023-31348 is a DLL hijacking vulnerability in AMD μProf that could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

CVE-2023-31349 is a vulnerability caused by incorrect default permissions in the AMD μProf installation directory, which could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation and potentially result in arbitrary code execution.

CVE-2023-31468 is a security issue discovered in Inosoft VisiWin 7 through 2022-2.1 (Runtime RT7.3 RC3 20221209.5). The vulnerability arises from weak permissions in the "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\INOSOFT GmbH" folder, allowing an attacker to insert a Trojan horse file that runs as SYSTEM. The issue is fixed in version 2024-1.

CVE-2023-31973 refers to a potential use-after-free vulnerability discovered in yasm v1.3.0 via the function `expand_mmac_params` at `/nasm/nasm-pp.c`. However, multiple third parties dispute this as a bug rather than a vulnerability, according to the YASM security policy.
CVE-2023-32123 is a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Dream-Theme's The7 which allows for Stored XSS. This issue affects The7 from versions that are not available through 11.7.3.

CVE-2023-32136 is a vulnerability identified as a Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution in D-Link DAP-1360 routers. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without requiring authentication. The flaw exists in handling requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint, specifically in parsing the var:menu parameter, where the length of user-supplied data is not properly validated before being copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. This can be leveraged by an attacker to execute code in the context of root.

CVE-2023-32138 refers to a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability affecting D-Link DAP-1360 routers. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code without requiring authentication. The flaw is in the handling of requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint, where there is a lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data before it is copied to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. Exploiting this vulnerability can lead to remote code execution in the context of root.

CVE-2023-32139 is a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability that allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Exploiting this vulnerability does not require authentication. The flaw exists in the handling of requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint due to the improper validation of user-supplied data length before copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can use this vulnerability to execute code with root privileges.

CVE-2023-32140 is a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1360 routers. It allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without needing authentication. This vulnerability is due to improper validation of the length of user-supplied data in requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint, specifically when parsing the var:sys_Token parameter. It enables attackers to execute code with root privileges. The vulnerability was identified as ZDI-CAN-18418.

Based on the provided context, CVE-2023-32141 is a vulnerability identified as the "D-Link DAP-1360 webproc WEB_DisplayPage Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers without requiring authentication. The specific flaw exists in how requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint handle the parsing of the getpage and errorpage parameters, with improper validation of user-supplied data length before copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.

CVE-2023-32142 is a stack-based buffer overflow remote code execution vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1360 routers. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code without the need for authentication. The flaw exists within the handling of requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint, where the length of user-supplied data is not properly validated before being copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. This can be exploited to execute code as root.

CVE-2023-32143 refers to a vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1360 routers involving the webupg UPGCGI_CheckAuth Numeric Truncation. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without requiring authentication. The flaw exists due to improper validation of user-supplied data when requesting the /cgi-bin/webupg endpoint, leading to an integer overflow before buffer allocation. Attackers can exploit this to execute code with root privileges.

CVE-2023-32144 is a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the D-Link DAP-1360 routers, specifically within the handling of requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of the router. Exploiting this vulnerability does not require authentication, and an attacker can execute code in the context of root.

CVE-2023-32145 is a vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1360 routers referred to as the "Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability." It allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on the affected installations. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability, which is due to the presence of hard-coded default credentials within the firmware. This issue specifically exists within the processing of login requests to the web-based user interface, enabling attackers to bypass authentication on the system.

CVE-2023-32146 refers to a D-Link DAP-1360 Multiple Parameters Stack-Based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers without authentication. The vulnerability is specifically related to the handling of the errorpage and nextpage parameters in the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint, where user-supplied data length is not properly validated before being copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. Exploiting this flaw allows attackers to execute code with root privileges.

CVE-2023-32149 is a vulnerability in D-Link DIR-2640 routers related to the "prog.cgi Request Handling" which allows for a stack-based buffer overflow leading to remote code execution. This vulnerability enables network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without requiring authentication. The flaw exists within the web management interface, which listens on TCP port 80 by default, and arises from improper validation of the length of user-supplied data before it is copied to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the root user.

CVE-2023-32154 is a vulnerability identified as Mikrotik RouterOS RADVD Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Mikrotik RouterOS without requiring authentication. The specific flaw exists within the Router Advertisement Daemon and results from improper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. It was identified as ZDI-CAN-19797.

CVE-2023-32155 is a vulnerability in Tesla Model 3 related to the bcmdhd driver, which allows local attackers to escalate privileges. This vulnerability results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, potentially leading to an out-of-bounds write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute code on the wifi subsystem to exploit this vulnerability, which can lead to privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution in the kernel context.

CVE-2023-32168 is a vulnerability in D-Link D-View that allows remote attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations. Exploiting this vulnerability requires authentication. The specific flaw exists within the showUser method, where there is a lack of proper authorization before accessing a privileged endpoint. An attacker can use this vulnerability to gain access to resources normally protected from the user.

CVE-2023-32176 is a vulnerability in VIPRE Antivirus Plus, specifically a SetPrivateConfig Directory Traversal Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. It allows local attackers to escalate privileges by exploiting a lack of proper validation in the SetPrivateConfig method, enabling arbitrary code execution in the context of SYSTEM.

CVE-2023-32177 is a Directory Traversal Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability in VIPRE Antivirus Plus. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges by exploiting a flaw within the DeleteHistoryFile method. The issue results from improper validation of a user-supplied path prior to file operations, which an attacker can leverage to execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

CVE-2023-32178 is a vulnerability in VIPRE Antivirus Plus, specifically referred to as the TelFileTransfer Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of VIPRE Antivirus Plus. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system. The flaw exists within the TelFileTransfer method, where an attacker can create a symbolic link to abuse the method for deleting arbitrary files. This can then be leveraged to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

CVE-2023-32179 is a vulnerability in VIPRE Antivirus Plus described as an FPQuarTransfer Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of VIPRE Antivirus Plus. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the FPQuarTransfer method. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the method to delete arbitrary files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

CVE-2023-32203 is a vulnerability in Horner Automation Cscape, which lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds write at CScape_EnvisionRV+0x2e374b. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2023-3242 is a vulnerability involving improper initialization implementation in Portmapper used in B&R Industrial Automation Automation Runtime versions less than G4.93. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated network-based attackers to cause permanent denial-of-service conditions.

CVE-2023-3243 is a vulnerability where an attacker can capture an authenticating hash and utilize it to create new sessions. The hash is a poorly salted MD5 hash, which could result in a successful brute force password attack. The impacted product is BCM-WEB version 3.3.X. The recommended fix is to upgrade to a supported product such as Alerton ACM. This CVE ID was assigned to ensure that all who are still running this product understand that it is end of life and should be removed or upgraded.

CVE-2023-32539 is a vulnerability in Horner Automation Cscape that results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (such as HMI). This vulnerability can lead to an out-of-bounds write at CScape_EnvisionRV+0x2e3c04, potentially allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2023-32649 is a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC. It is due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of their IDS. This allows an unauthenticated attacker to crash the IDS module by sending specially crafted malformed network packets. During the limited time window before the IDS module is automatically restarted, network traffic may not be analyzed.

CVE-2023-3295 is a vulnerability in the Unlimited Elements For Elementor (Free Widgets, Addons, Templates) for WordPress, which is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to missing file type validation in the file manager functionality in versions up to, and including, 1.5.66. This allows authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server, potentially enabling remote code execution. The issue was partially patched in version 1.5.66 and fully patched in version 1.5.67. CVE-2023-31231 appears to be a duplicate of this issue.

CVE-2023-33237 refers to a vulnerability in TN-5900 Series firmware version v3.3 and prior, which is susceptible to an improper authentication vulnerability. This flaw stems from inadequate authentication measures in the web API handler, allowing low-privileged APIs to perform actions that should only be accessible to high-privileged APIs. This presents a risk of unauthorized exploitation by malicious actors.

CVE-2023-33238 is a command injection vulnerability found in TN-4900 Series firmware versions v1.2.4 and prior and TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior. The vulnerability arises from inadequate input validation in the certificate management function, which could potentially allow malicious users to execute remote code on affected devices.

CVE-2023-33239 is a command injection vulnerability affecting TN-4900 Series firmware versions v1.2.4 and prior and TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior. It stems from insufficient input validation in the key-generation function, potentially allowing malicious users to execute remote code on affected devices.

CVE-2023-33327 is an "Improper Privilege Management" vulnerability in Teplitsa of social technologies Leyka, which allows for privilege escalation. This issue affects Leyka from n/a through version 3.30.2.

CVE-2023-33850 is a vulnerability in IBM GSKit-Crypto that could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. This vulnerability is caused by a timing-based side channel in the RSA Decryption implementation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an overly large number of trial messages for decryption.

CVE-2023-33990 is a vulnerability in SAP SQL Anywhere, version 17.0, which allows an attacker to prevent legitimate users from accessing the service by crashing it. An attacker with a low privileged account and access to the local system can write into the shared memory objects, potentially performing a Denial of Service. Additionally, an attacker might be able to modify sensitive data in shared memory objects. This issue affects only SAP SQL Anywhere on Windows and does not impact other platforms.

CVE-2023-34116 refers to an issue in improper input validation in the Zoom Desktop Client for Windows before version 5.15.0, which may allow an unauthorized user to enable an escalation of privilege via network access.
CVE-2023-34118 involves improper privilege management in Zoom Rooms for Windows before version 5.14.5, which may allow an authenticated user to enable an escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2023-34119 refers to an insecure temporary file in the installer for Zoom Rooms for Windows before version 5.15.0. This vulnerability may allow an authenticated user to enable an escalation of privilege via local access.

CVE-2023-34120 involves improper privilege management in Zoom for Windows, Zoom Rooms for Windows, and Zoom VDI for Windows clients prior to version 5.14.0. This vulnerability may allow an authenticated user to potentially escalate privileges via local access. Users might be able to utilize higher-level system privileges maintained by the Zoom client to spawn processes with escalated privileges.

This vulnerability arises due to insufficient input validation and improper authentication in the key-generation function. It could potentially allow malicious users to execute remote code on affected devices.

CVE-2023-34215 pertains to a command-injection vulnerability in the TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior.
