CVE-2024-24762 is a vulnerability in the `python-multipart` library, a streaming multipart parser for Python. This vulnerability involves a regular expression used to parse the HTTP `Content-Type` header. An attacker could exploit this by sending a custom-made `Content-Type` option that is difficult for the regular expression to process, potentially consuming CPU resources and causing denial of service by stalling the main event loop. The issue has been patched in version 0.0.7 of the library.

CVE-2024-25102 is a vulnerability in the AppSamvid software due to the use of a weaker cryptographic algorithm (SHA1) in the user login component. An attacker with local administrative privileges could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the password of AppSamvid on the targeted system, potentially allowing the attacker to take complete control of the application on the targeted system.

CVE-2024-25568 refers to an OS command injection vulnerability in ELECOM wireless LAN routers. This vulnerability allows a network-adjacent unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands by sending a specially crafted request to the product. The affected products and versions include WRC-X3200GST3-B v1.25 and earlier, WRC-G01-W v1.24 and earlier, and WMC-X1800GST-B v1.41 and earlier. Note that WMC-X1800GST-B is also included in the e-Mesh Starter Kit "WMC-2LX-B".

CVE-2024-25646 refers to a vulnerability in SAP BusinessObject Business Intelligence Launch Pad, which, due to improper validation, allows an authenticated attacker to access operating system information using a crafted document. Successful exploitation could significantly impact the confidentiality of the application.

CVE-2024-25699 refers to a difficult-to-exploit improper authentication issue in the Home application for Esri Portal for ArcGIS versions 10.8.1 through 11.2 on Windows and Linux, and ArcGIS Enterprise 11.1 and below on Kubernetes. Under unique circumstances, this vulnerability could potentially allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to compromise the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the software.

CVE-2024-25723 refers to a vulnerability in the ZenML Server within the ZenML machine learning package for Python, versions before 0.46.7. This vulnerability allows remote privilege escalation due to the /api/v1/users/{user_name_or_id}/activate REST API endpoint permitting access based on a valid username and a new password provided in the request body. It has been patched in versions 0.46.7, as well as previous versions 0.44.4, 0.43.1, and 0.42.2.

CVE-2024-25743 pertains to a vulnerability in the Linux kernel, specifically versions up to 6.9. An untrusted hypervisor can inject virtual interrupts 0 and 14 at any point, potentially triggering the SIGFPE signal handler in userspace applications. This vulnerability affects AMD SEV-SNP and AMD SEV-ES technologies.

CVE-2024-25928 is an Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Sitepact. This issue affects Sitepact from an unspecified version through 1.0.5.

CVE-2024-25993 refers to a vulnerability in the function `tmu_reset_tmu_trip_counter`, where there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This vulnerability could lead to a local escalation of privilege without needing additional execution privileges. User interaction is not required for exploitation.

CVE-2024-26029 is an Improper Access Control vulnerability affecting Adobe Experience Manager versions 6.5.20 and earlier. This vulnerability could result in a security feature bypass, allowing an attacker to bypass security measures and disclose information without requiring user interaction.

CVE-2024-26258 refers to an OS command injection vulnerability found in ELECOM wireless LAN routers. This vulnerability allows a network-adjacent attacker with credentials to execute arbitrary OS commands by sending a specially crafted request to the product.

CVE-2024-26275 is a vulnerability that has been identified in several software applications including JT2Go (all versions before V2312.0004), Parasolid V35.1 (all versions before V35.1.254), Parasolid V36.0 (all versions before V36.0.207), Parasolid V36.1 (all versions before V36.1.147), Teamcenter Visualization V14.2 (all versions before V14.2.0.12), Teamcenter Visualization V14.3 (all versions before V14.3.0.9), and Teamcenter Visualization V2312 (all versions before V2312.0004). The vulnerability is due to an out-of-bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted X_T files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-2635 involves configuration pages that should not be placed on an Internet-facing web server as they expose file paths to clients, potentially allowing attackers to access them. These pages will be removed from future releases of Cegid Meta4 HR as they don't offer necessary product functionality.

CVE-2024-2637 is an Uncontrolled Search Path Element vulnerability in various B&R Industrial Automation products, including Scene Viewer, Automation Runtime, mapp Vision, mapp View, mapp Cockpit, mapp Safety, and VC4. This vulnerability allows an authenticated local attacker to execute malicious code by placing specially crafted files in the loading search path. The affected versions are Scene Viewer before 4.4.0, Automation Runtime before J4.93, mapp Vision before 5.26.1, mapp View before 5.24.2, mapp Cockpit before 5.24.2, mapp Safety before 5.24.2, and VC4 before 4.73.2.

CVE-2024-26482 is an HTML injection vulnerability in the Edit Content Layout module of Kirby CMS v4.1.0. The vendor disputes the significance of this report because some HTML formatting (such as with an H1 element) is allowed, but there is backend sanitization to prevent "injecting malicious scripts" as mentioned by the reporter.

CVE-2024-26581 is a resolved vulnerability in the Linux kernel, specifically in the netfilter component. The issue relates to the nft_set_rbtree, where the rbtree lazy garbage collector on insert might collect an end interval element that has just been added in a transaction. The fix involves skipping end interval elements that are not yet active.

CVE-2024-2700 is a vulnerability found in the quarkus-core component. Quarkus captures local environment variables from the Quarkus namespace during the application's build. As a result, running the resulting application inherits the values captured at build time. Some local environment variables may be set by the developer or CI environment for testing purposes, such as dropping the database during application startup or trusting all TLS certificates to accept self-signed certificates. These properties, if configured using environment variables or the .env facility, are captured into the built application, potentially leading to dangerous behavior if the application does not override these values. This behavior is limited to configuration properties from the `quarkus.` namespace, as application-specific properties are not captured.

CVE-2024-27205 is a vulnerability that involves possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed, and user interaction is not required for exploitation.

CVE-2024-27206 refers to a vulnerability involving a possible out-of-bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This vulnerability could lead to remote information disclosure without requiring additional execution privileges or user interaction for exploitation.

CVE-2024-27208 describes a potential out-of-bounds write vulnerability due to a missing bounds check. This vulnerability could result in a local escalation of privileges without the need for additional execution privileges. Exploitation does not require user interaction.

CVE-2024-27209 is a possible out of bounds write vulnerability due to a heap buffer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

CVE-2024-27212 involves a potential out of bounds write in the `init_data` function due to a lack of bounds checking. This vulnerability could lead to local escalation of privilege without requiring any additional execution privileges, and user interaction is not necessary for exploitation.

CVE-2024-27220 describes a possible out of bounds memory access vulnerability in the `lpm_req_handler`. This vulnerability is due to a missing bounds check, which could lead to local escalation of privilege without requiring any additional execution privileges. No user interaction is needed for the exploitation of this vulnerability.

CVE-2024-27221 is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check in the `update_policy_data` function. This vulnerability could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed, and no user interaction is required for exploitation.

CVE-2024-27226 is a vulnerability identified as a possible out of bounds write in the `tmu_config_gov_params` function due to a missing bounds check. This vulnerability could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed, and its exploitation does not require user interaction.

CVE-2024-27312 refers to an authorization vulnerability in Zohocorp ManageEngine PAM360 version 6601 that allows a low-privileged user to perform admin actions. It is important to note that this vulnerability affects only the PAM360 6600 version, and no other versions are applicable to this vulnerability.

CVE-2024-2746 refers to an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-1929. The original problem with CVE-2024-1929 was that the `dnf5` D-Bus daemon accepted arbitrary configuration parameters from unprivileged users. This allowed a local root exploit by tricking the daemon into loading a user-controlled "plugin" before Polkit authentication started. The `dnf5` library did not check whether non-root users controlled the directory in question, leading to potential denial-of-service attacks or allowing the daemon to process privileged files like `/etc/shadow`. Error diagnostics from parsing privileged files could cause information leaks if accessible to unprivileged users, and a local attacker could place a valid repository configuration file in this directory to access various code paths in `libdnf5`.

CVE-2024-27575 is a vulnerability in INOTEC Sicherheitstechnik WebServer CPS220/64 version 3.3.19, which allows a remote attacker to read arbitrary files via absolute path traversal, such as with the `/cgi-bin/display?file=/etc/passwd` URI.

CVE-2024-2759 is an improper access control vulnerability in the Apaczka plugin for PrestaShop. It allows information gathering from saved templates without authentication. This issue affects the Apaczka plugin for PrestaShop from version 1 through version 4.

CVE-2024-27622 is a remote code execution vulnerability identified in the User Defined Tags module of CMS Made Simple version 2.2.19 / 2.2.21. This vulnerability arises from inadequate sanitization of user-supplied input in the 'Code' section of the module, allowing authenticated users with administrative privileges to inject and execute arbitrary PHP code.

CVE-2024-27756 is a vulnerability in GLPI versions through 10.0.12 that allows for CSV injection. An attacker can exploit this by creating an asset with a specially crafted title, which can lead to potential security issues.

CVE-2024-27929 describes a heap-use-after-free vulnerability found in the `InitializeImage()` function of the PngDecoderCore.cs file of ImageSharp, a managed, cross-platform, 2D graphics library. This issue is triggered when an attacker provides a specially crafted PNG image file to ImageSharp for conversion, which can potentially lead to information disclosure. The vulnerability has been patched in ImageSharp versions 3.1.3 and 2.1.7.

CVE-2024-27936 is a vulnerability in the Deno JavaScript, TypeScript, and WebAssembly runtime. The issue exists in versions starting from 1.32.1 and prior to 1.41.0. A maliciously crafted permission request can show a spoofed permission prompt by inserting a broken ANSI escape sequence into the request contents. While Deno strips any ANSI escape sequences from the permission prompt, permissions given to the program are based on the content containing these sequences. This vulnerability allows a malicious Deno program to display incorrect file paths or program names to the user. The vulnerability is patched in Deno library version 1.41.0.

CVE-2024-28020 refers to a user/password reuse vulnerability found in the FOXMAN-UN/UNEM application and server management. If exploited, a malicious high-privileged user could access passwords and login information through complex routines to extend access on the server and other related services.

CVE-2024-28021 is a vulnerability in the FOXMAN-UN/UNEM server that affects the message queueing mechanism’s certificate validation. If exploited, an attacker could spoof a trusted entity, causing a loss of confidentiality and integrity.

CVE-2024-28029 refers to a security vulnerability where privileges are not fully verified server-side. This vulnerability can be exploited by a user with limited privileges to bypass authorization and access privileged functionality.

CVE-2024-28088 refers to a vulnerability in LangChain through version 0.1.10, which allows directory traversal by an actor who can control the final part of the path parameter in a load_chain call. This bypasses the intended behavior of loading configurations only from the hwchase17/langchain-hub GitHub repository, potentially leading to the disclosure of an API key for a large language model online service or remote code execution. A patch for this vulnerability is available as of release 0.1.29 of langchain-core.
CVE-2024-28093 is a vulnerability related to the TELNET service of AdTran NetVanta 3120 18.01.01.00.E devices, which is enabled by default and has default credentials for a root-level account.

CVE-2024-28252 is a vulnerability related to CoreWCF, which is a port of the service side of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) to .NET Core. The vulnerability involves extra system resources being consumed due to connections being left established instead of being closed or aborted. This can happen in two scenarios: when a client establishes a connection and sends no data, causing the service to wait indefinitely for the session handshake, and when a client has established a session but doesn't send any requests for the duration specified in the binding's ReceiveTimeout, resulting in an improperly closed connection. The affected bindings are NetTcpBinding, NetNamedPipeBinding, and UnixDomainSocketBinding, with NetTcpBinding being the only one able to accept non-local connections. The issue has been fixed in versions 1.4.2 and 1.5.2 of CoreWCF, and users are advised to upgrade as there are no workarounds.

CVE-2024-28254 refers to a vulnerability in OpenMetadata, a platform for discovery, observability, and governance. The vulnerability exists in the `AlertUtil::validateExpression` method, which evaluates an SpEL expression using `getValue`, potentially allowing it to interact with Java classes like `java.lang.Runtime`, leading to Remote Code Execution (RCE). This can be exploited via the `/api/v1/events/subscriptions/validation/condition/` endpoint by authenticated non-admin users to execute arbitrary commands on the operating system. There is also a missing authorization check in the affected path. The issue is addressed in version 1.2.4, and upgrading is recommended as there are no known workarounds. This vulnerability is also tracked as `GHSL-2023-235`.

CVE-2024-28735 refers to an incorrect access control authorization bypass vulnerability in Unit4 Financials by Coda versions prior to 2023Q4. This vulnerability allows an authenticated user to modify the password of any user of the application via a crafted request.

CVE-2024-28848 is a vulnerability in the OpenMetadata platform that allows Remote Code Execution (RCE). The issue arises from improper validation in the `CompiledRule::validateExpression` method, which evaluates an SpEL expression using a `StandardEvaluationContext`. This allows the expression to interact with Java classes like `java.lang.Runtime`. The endpoint `/api/v1/policies/validation/condition/` passes user-controlled data to `CompiledRule::validateExpession`, enabling authenticated (non-admin) users to execute arbitrary system commands. The vulnerability is exacerbated by a missing authorization check, as `Authorizer.authorize()` is not called. This issue is tracked as `GHSL-2023-236` and has been resolved in version 1.2.4. There are no known workarounds, so users are advised to upgrade.

CVE-2024-29014 is a vulnerability in the SonicWall SMA100 NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client versions 10.2.339 and earlier. This vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code when processing an EPC Client update.

CVE-2024-29152 is an issue discovered in Samsung Mobile Processor, Wearable Processor, and Modem Exynos 980, Exynos 990, Exynos 1080, Exynos 2100, Exynos 2200, Exynos 1280, Exynos 1380, Exynos 1330, Exynos 2400, Exynos Modem 5123, and Exynos Modem 5300. The baseband software does not properly check states specified by the RRC (Radio Resource Control) Reconfiguration message, which can lead to the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2024-29176 is an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in Dell PowerProtect DD, versions 8.0, 7.13.1.0, 7.10.1.30, and 7.7.5.40. A low privileged attacker with remote access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to code execution.

CVE-2024-29218 is an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that exists in KV STUDIO Ver.11.64 and earlier, KV REPLAY VIEWER Ver.2.64 and earlier, and VT5-WX15/WX12 Ver.6.02 and earlier. This vulnerability may lead to information disclosure or arbitrary code execution by having a user of the affected product open a specially crafted file.

CVE-2024-29219 is an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in KV STUDIO Ver.11.64 and earlier, KV REPLAY VIEWER Ver.2.64 and earlier, and VT5-WX15/WX12 Ver.6.02 and earlier. This vulnerability may lead to information disclosure or arbitrary code execution when a user of the affected product opens a specially crafted file.

CVE-2024-29686 refers to a Server-side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerability in Winter CMS version 1.2.3. This vulnerability could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted payload in the CMS Pages field and Plugin components. However, the vendor disputes this vulnerability because the payload could only be entered by a trusted user, such as the owner of the server hosting Winter CMS, or a developer working for them.

CVE-2024-29944 is a vulnerability where an attacker was able to inject an event handler into a privileged object, allowing arbitrary JavaScript execution in the parent process. This vulnerability affects only Desktop Firefox versions earlier than 124.0.1 and Firefox ESR versions earlier than 115.9.1. It does not affect mobile versions of Firefox.

CVE-2024-29946 is a vulnerability in Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.1, 9.1.4, and 9.0.9. The Dashboard Examples Hub lacks protections for risky SPL commands, which could allow attackers to bypass SPL safeguards for risky commands in the Hub. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to phish the victim into initiating a request within their browser.

CVE-2024-29968 is an information disclosure vulnerability in Brocade SANnav prior to versions v2.3.1 and v2.3.0a. When Brocade SANnav instances are configured in disaster recovery mode, SQL Table names, column names, and SQL queries are collected in DR standby Supportsave. This could allow authenticated users to access the database structure and its contents.
CVE-2024-30105 is a Denial of Service Vulnerability related to .NET and Visual Studio.

CVE-2024-30321 is a vulnerability identified in multiple versions of Siemens software products, including SIMATIC PCS 7, SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional, and SIMATIC WinCC. The affected products do not properly handle certain requests to their web application, which may lead to the leak of privileged information. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to retrieve sensitive information, such as users and passwords.

CVE-2024-3037 is an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability that exists in PaperCut NG/MF, specifically affecting Windows servers with Web Print enabled. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must first obtain local login access to the Windows Server hosting PaperCut NG/MF and be capable of executing low-privilege code directly on the server. The risk is mitigated by default Windows Server configurations that typically restrict local login access to Administrators, but it poses a risk if non-administrative users are allowed local console login. The CVE has been split into two separate CVEs (CVE-2024-3037 and CVE-2024-8404) and has been rescored with a "Privileges Required (PR)" rating of low and “Attack Complexity (AC)” rating of low, considering the worst-case scenario of granting local login access to standard users on the host server.

CVE-2024-30380 is an "Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions" vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved, which allows an adjacent unauthenticated attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). This is achieved by causing the l2cpd process to crash through the sending of a specific TLV. This process is responsible for managing layer 2 control protocols like STP, RSTP, MSTP, VSTP, ERP, and LLDP. The crash impacts these STP protocols (RSTP, MSTP, or VSTP), as well as MVRP and ERP, leading to DoS. The continued receipt and processing of the specific TLV will create a sustained DoS condition. The issue affects multiple versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved.

CVE-2024-30381 is an Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in Juniper Networks Paragon Active Assurance Control Center. It allows a network-adjacent attacker with root access to a Test Agent Appliance to access sensitive information about downstream devices. The vulnerability is due to the "netrounds-probe-login" daemon (also called probe_serviced) exposing functions that reveal internal database objects, which can be used for direct database access on the Control Center. This issue affects Paragon Active Assurance versions 4.1.0 and 4.2.0.

CVE-2024-30382 is an Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the routing protocol daemon (rpd) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. It allows a network-based, unauthenticated attacker to send a specific routing update, causing an rpd core due to memory corruption, leading to a Denial of Service (DoS). This issue can be triggered when the system is configured for CoS-based forwarding (CBF) with a policy map containing a cos-next-hop-map action. This vulnerability affects several versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved before specified versions.

CVE-2024-30386 is a Use-After-Free vulnerability in the Layer 2 Address Learning Daemon (l2ald) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. It allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause l2ald to crash, leading to a Denial-of-Service (DoS). The crash can occur in an EVPN-VXLAN scenario when state updates are received and processed by the affected system. The correct order of some processing steps is not ensured, depending on system internal timing, which is outside the attacker's control. This issue affects various versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved.

CVE-2024-30387 is a Missing Synchronization vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (PFE) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on ACX5448 and ACX710. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial-of-Service (DoS). If an interface flaps while the system gathers statistics on that interface, two processes simultaneously access a shared resource, leading to a PFE crash and restart. This issue affects various versions of Junos OS before specified updates.

CVE-2024-30388 is an Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (PFE) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on QFX5000 Series and EX Series. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). If a specific malformed LACP packet is received by devices such as a QFX5000 Series, or an EX4400, EX4100, or EX4650 Series device, it can cause an LACP flap, resulting in traffic loss. The issue affects various versions of Junos OS on these series.

CVE-2024-30392 is a Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in the Flow Processing Daemon (flowd) of Juniper Networks Junos OS. It allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). This issue occurs on all Junos OS MX Series platforms with SPC3 and MS-MPC/-MIC when URL filtering is enabled and a specific URL request is processed, causing flowd to crash and restart. Continuous reception of the specific URL request leads to a sustained DoS condition. The affected versions are all versions before 21.2R3-S6, and from 21.3 before 21.3R3-S5, from 21.4 before 21.4R3-S5, from 22.1 before 22.1R3-S3, from 22.2 before 22.2R3-S1, from 22.3 before 22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3, and from 22.4 before 22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3.

The CVE-2024-30394 refers to a Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in the Routing Protocol Daemon (RPD) component of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause an rpd crash, leading to Denial of Service (DoS). It affects all Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved platforms when EVPN is configured, and a specific EVPN type-5 route is received via BGP, causing rpd crashes and restarts, which can lead to a sustained DoS condition. It affects several versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved.

CVE-2024-30395 is an Improper Validation of Specified Type of Input vulnerability in the Routing Protocol Daemon (RPD) of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). It occurs when a BGP update containing a specifically malformed TLV is received over an established BGP session, causing the RPD to crash and restart. This issue affects specific versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved as detailed in the context.

CVE-2024-30397 describes an Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the Public Key Infrastructure daemon (pkid) of Juniper Networks Junos OS. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated networked attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). Specifically, when a certificate verification fails, the pkid daemon consumes all CPU resources, rendering it unresponsive to future verification attempts, and causing all subsequent VPN negotiations that depend on certificate verification to fail. This issue affects several versions of Junos OS prior to 23.2R2.

CVE-2024-30398 is an Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (PFE) of Juniper Networks Junos OS. It allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). When a high amount of specific traffic is received on an SRX4600 device, an error in internal packet handling leads to a consistent rise in CPU memory utilization, resulting in packet drops and eventually causing the PFE to crash. A manual reboot of the PFE is required to restore the device to its original state. This issue affects multiple versions of Junos OS, specifically versions before certain updates starting from 21.2 up to 23.2.

CVE-2024-30401 is an Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in the advanced forwarding management process (aftman) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on MX Series with MPC10E, MPC11, MX10K-LC9600 line cards, MX304, and EX9200-15C. It may allow an attacker to exploit a stack-based buffer overflow, leading to a reboot of the FPC. This issue affects specific versions of Junos OS on MX Series and EX9200-15C, and does not affect versions prior to 20.3R1 or any version of Junos OS 20.4.

CVE-2024-30402 is an Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the Layer 2 Address Learning Daemon (l2ald) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). When telemetry requests are sent to the device, and the Dynamic Rendering Daemon (drend) is suspended, the l2ald crashes and restarts due to factors outside the attacker's control. Repeated occurrences of these events cause a sustained DoS condition. The issue affects various versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved as specified in the context.

CVE-2024-30403 is a NULL Pointer Dereference vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (PFE) of Juniper Networks Junos OS Evolved. It allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS). This occurs when Layer 2 traffic is sent through a logical interface, and MAC learning takes place. If the interface flaps during this process, an Advanced Forwarding Toolkit manager (evo-aftmand-bt) core is observed, leading to a PFE restart. The crash will reoccur with the same sequence of events, resulting in a sustained DoS condition. This issue affects Juniper Networks Junos OS Evolved 23.2-EVO versions earlier than 23.2R1-S1-EVO, 23.2R2-EVO.

CVE-2024-30405 is an Incorrect Calculation of Buffer Size vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS SRX 5000 Series devices using SPC2 line cards with ALGs enabled. This vulnerability allows an attacker to send specifically crafted packets that can cause a transit traffic Denial of Service (DoS). Continual receipt and processing of these packets will sustain the DoS condition. It affects all versions earlier than the specified versions across Junos OS SRX 5000 Series with SPC2 with ALGs enabled.

CVE-2024-30407 is a "Use of a Hard-coded Cryptographic Key" vulnerability found in Juniper Networks' Juniper Cloud Native Router (JCNR) and containerized routing Protocol Deamon (cRPD) products. This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform Person-in-the-Middle (PitM) attacks, leading to a complete compromise of the container. The issue is due to hardcoded SSH host keys being present on the container, enabling a PitM attacker to intercept SSH traffic without detection. It affects all versions of JCNR and cRPD before version 23.4R1.

CVE-2024-3046 is a vulnerability in the Eclipse Kura LogServlet component, affecting versions from 5.0.0 to 5.4.1. An unauthenticated user can retrieve device logs through a specifically crafted request to the servlet. The downloaded logs may contain session IDs of authenticated users, which can be used by an attacker to perform privilege escalation. This issue affects the org.eclipse.kura:org.eclipse.kura.web2 version range [2.0.600, 2.4.0], which is included in Eclipse Kura version range [5.0.0, 5.4.1].

CVE-2024-30494 is an Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in 沈唁 OSS Aliyun. This issue affects OSS Aliyun from unspecified versions through 1.4.10.

CVE-2024-3051 refers to a vulnerability where malformed Device Reset Locally command classes can be sent to temporarily deny service to an end device. During this time, any frames sent by the end device will not be acknowledged by the gateway.
CVE-2024-3052 involves malformed S2 Nonce Get command classes that can be sent to crash the gateway. A hard reset is required to recover the gateway.

CVE-2024-30875 is a Cross Site Scripting vulnerability in the JavaScript Library jquery-ui version 1.13.1. It allows a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information and execute arbitrary code via a crafted payload targeting the window.addEventListener component. However, this vulnerability is disputed by the supplier because it cannot be reproduced, and the exploitation example does not indicate whether or how the example website is using jQuery UI.

CVE-2024-31090 is an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in 荒野无灯 Hacklog Down As PDF, which allows for Reflected XSS. This issue affects Hacklog Down As PDF from versions n/a through 2.3.6.

CVE-2024-31256 is an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WebinarPress. This vulnerability allows for Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) and affects versions of WebinarPress from an unspecified version through 1.33.10.

CVE-2024-31336 is a vulnerability in PVRSRVBridgeRGXKickTA3D2 of server_rgxta3d_bridge.c, where there is a possible arbitrary code execution due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

CVE-2024-31365 is an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation vulnerability, also known as a Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. It affects the Themify Post Type Builder (PTB) plugin, specifically versions before 2.1.1. This vulnerability allows for Reflected XSS attacks.

CVE-2024-31484 is a vulnerability identified in several Central Processing/Communication devices and Ethernet interfaces. The vulnerability is due to improper null termination while parsing a specific HTTP header. This flaw could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process or lead to a denial of service condition. The affected devices include:- CPC80 Central Processing/Communication (All versions < V16.41)- CPCI85 Central Processing/Communication (All versions < V5.30)- CPCX26 Central Processing/Communication (All versions < V06.02)- ETA4 Ethernet Interface IEC60870-5-104 (All versions < V10.46)- ETA5 Ethernet Int. 1x100TX IEC61850 Ed.2 (All versions < V03.27)- PCCX26 Ax 1703 PE, Contr, Communication Element (All versions < V06.05)

CVE-2024-31498 is a vulnerability in Yubico ykman-gui (aka YubiKey Manager GUI) versions before 1.2.6 on Windows. When Edge is not used, the vulnerability allows privilege escalation because browser windows can open as Administrator.
The provided context does not contain information about CVE-2024-31964.

CVE-2024-31970 involves a vulnerability in AdTran SRG 834-5 HDC17600021F1 devices running SmartOS 11.1.1.1. SSH is enabled by default on these devices, accessible over both LAN and the Internet. During setup, a default username and password (admin/admin) with root-level privileges are used. An attacker can exploit this setup window to gain unauthorized root access. The vendor disputes this report, stating that SSH was never accessible from WAN on official SmartOS builds, and the specific test build mentioned was never released to end users.

CVE-2024-31977 refers to vulnerabilities in Adtran 834-5 version 11.1.0.101-202106231430, which allow OS Command Injection via shell metacharacters to the Ping or Traceroute utility. These vulnerabilities have been fixed as of SmartOS Version 12.6.3.1.

CVE-2024-3203 is a critical vulnerability found in c-blosc2 up to version 2.13.2, affecting the function `ndlz8_decompress` in the file `/src/c-blosc2/plugins/codecs/ndlz/ndlz8x8.c`. This vulnerability leads to a heap-based buffer overflow, and the attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 2.14.3 can address this issue. The identifier assigned to this vulnerability is VDB-259050.

CVE-2024-3204 is a critical vulnerability found in c-blosc2 up to version 2.13.2. It affects the function `ndlz4_decompress` located in the file `/src/c-blosc2/plugins/codecs/ndlz/ndlz4x4.c` and leads to a heap-based buffer overflow. The vulnerability can be exploited remotely and the exploit has been publicly disclosed. To address this issue, an upgrade to version 2.14.3 is recommended. The associated identifier for this vulnerability is VDB-259051.

CVE-2024-32055 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions prior to V2406) that involves an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

It involves a type confusion vulnerability that occurs while parsing IGS files, potentially allowing an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process. This vulnerability is referenced with the identifier ZDI-CAN-21562.

CVE-2024-32058 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions prior to V2406) that results in memory corruption while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process. (ZDI-CAN-21563)

The affected applications contain an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process. (ZDI-CAN-21564)

The affected applications contain an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

The issue involves an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-32062 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions before V2406) that involves a type confusion vulnerability while parsing IGS files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process. It is associated with the identifier ZDI-CAN-21568.

CVE-2024-32063 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions prior to V2406). The issue is a type confusion vulnerability that occurs during the parsing of IGS files. This vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to execute code within the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-32064 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions earlier than V2406) that involves an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files. This could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-32065 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions before V2406). The issue involves an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure when parsing specially crafted IGS files. CVE-2024-32066 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions prior to V2406). The vulnerability involves an out-of-bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted IGS files, which could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process. CVE-2024-32358 is an issue in Jpress version 5.1.0 that allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the custom plug-in module function. It is a different vulnerability from CVE-2024-43033.

CVE-2024-32635 is a vulnerability identified in JT2Go (all versions prior to V2312.0005), Teamcenter Visualization V14.2 (all versions prior to V14.2.0.12), Teamcenter Visualization V14.3 (all versions prior to V14.3.0.10), and Teamcenter Visualization V2312 (all versions prior to V2312.0005). The affected applications contain an out of bounds read past the unmapped memory region while parsing specially crafted X_T files. This could potentially allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-32636 is a vulnerability identified in JT2Go (all versions < V2312.0005), Teamcenter Visualization V14.2 (all versions < V14.2.0.12), Teamcenter Visualization V14.3 (all versions < V14.3.0.10), and Teamcenter Visualization V2312 (all versions < V2312.0005). The affected applications have an out of bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted X_T files. This could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-3273 is a vulnerability classified as critical, found in D-Link DNS-320L, DNS-325, DNS-327L, and DNS-340L up to the date 20240403. The vulnerability affects an unknown function of the file /cgi-bin/nas_sharing.cgi of the component HTTP GET Request Handler. Manipulating the argument system can lead to command injection, and the attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-259284. The vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer, and the vendor confirmed that the product is end-of-life and should be retired and replaced.
CVE-2024-32759 describes a situation where, under certain circumstances, the Software House C●CURE 9000 installer utilizes weak credentials.

CVE-2024-32807 is an Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Brevo Sendinblue for WooCommerce. It allows Relative Path Traversal, manipulating web input to file system calls, affecting Sendinblue for WooCommerce versions up through 4.0.17.
CVE-2024-32861 involves a situation where, under certain circumstances, the Software House C●CURE 9000 Site Server provides insufficient protection of directories containing executables.

CVE-2024-32982 refers to a Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability discovered in the Litestar and Starlite frameworks, which are Asynchronous Server Gateway Interface (ASGI) frameworks. This vulnerability was found in the static file serving component of Litestar, allowing attackers to exploit path traversal flaws that enable unauthorized access to sensitive files outside of designated directories. Such access can lead to disclosure of sensitive information or potentially compromise the server. It was specifically located in the file path handling mechanism within the static content serving function at `litestar/static_files/base.py`. The vulnerability is fixed in versions 2.8.3, 2.7.2, and 2.6.4 of the affected frameworks.
CVE-2024-3313 refers to vulnerabilities identified by SUBNET Solutions Inc. in third-party components used in PowerSYSTEM Server 2021 and Substation Server 2021.

CVE-2024-33309 refers to an issue in TVS Motor Company Limited's TVS Connect Android version 4.5.1 and iOS version 5.0.0, where a remote attacker can obtain sensitive information via an insecure API endpoint. However, it is noted that this is disputed as discussed in the msn-official/CVE-Evidence repository.

CVE-2024-33577 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap (all versions prior to V2406). This vulnerability involves a stack overflow issue that occurs while parsing specially crafted strings as arguments for one of the application binaries. It could allow an attacker to execute code within the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-3371 is a vulnerability in MongoDB Compass where the application may accept and use insufficiently validated input from an untrusted external source. This vulnerability can cause unintended application behavior, including data disclosure and enabling attackers to impersonate users. It affects MongoDB Compass versions 1.35.0 to 1.42.0.

CVE-2024-34010 is a local privilege escalation vulnerability caused by an unquoted search path issue. It affects Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud Agent (Windows) before build 37758 and Acronis Cyber Protect 16 (Windows) before build 38690.

CVE-2024-34338 is a vulnerability in Tenda O3V2 with firmware versions V1.0.0.10 and V1.0.0.12, which was discovered to contain a Blind Command Injection via the `dest` parameter in /goform/getTraceroute. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.

CVE-2024-34391 refers to a type confusion vulnerability in the library libxmljs, which occurs when parsing a specially crafted XML while invoking a function on the result of `attrs()` that was called on a parsed node. This vulnerability could lead to denial of service on both 32-bit and 64-bit systems, data leak, infinite loop, and remote code execution on 32-bit systems with the XML_PARSE_HUGE flag enabled.
I'm sorry, but the information about CVE-2024-34455 is not available in the provided context.

CVE-2024-3446 is a double free vulnerability found in QEMU virtio devices (virtio-gpu, virtio-serial-bus, virtio-crypto). The issue arises from the mem_reentrancy_guard flag insufficiently protecting against DMA reentrancy issues. This vulnerability could enable a malicious privileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host, leading to a denial of service or permitting arbitrary code execution within the context of the QEMU process on the host.

CVE-2024-34949 is a SQL injection vulnerability in Likeshop before version 2.5.7. It allows attackers to run arbitrary SQL commands via the function `OrderLogic::getOrderList`, exploited at the `/admin/order/lists.html` endpoint.
CVE-2024-34950 is a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability discovered in the SetNetworkTomographySettings module of D-Link DIR-822+ v1.0.5.

CVE-2024-34997 refers to a potential deserialization vulnerability discovered in joblib version 1.4.2 via the component `joblib.numpy_pickle::NumpyArrayWrapper().read_array()`. However, this vulnerability is disputed by the supplier because the `NumpyArrayWrapper` is only used during caching of trusted content.

CVE-2024-35061 refers to a vulnerability discovered in NASA AIT-Core v2.5.2, where unencrypted channels are used to exchange data over the network. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute a man-in-the-middle attack. When chained with CVE-2024-35059, it leads to unauthenticated, fully remote code execution.

CVE-2024-35204 is associated with Veritas System Recovery before version 23.3_Hotfix. This vulnerability involves incorrect permissions for the Veritas System Recovery folder, allowing low-privileged users to conduct attacks.
CVE-2024-35260 is an untrusted search path vulnerability in Microsoft Dataverse that allows an authenticated attacker to execute code over a network.

CVE-2024-35584 is a vulnerability involving SQL injection in certain PHP files of OpenSis Community Edition versions 9.1 to 8.0, and possibly earlier versions. Authenticated users can perform SQL Injection due to a lack of sanitization. The application takes arbitrary values from the "X-Forwarded-For" header and appends them directly to a SQL INSERT statement, leading to this vulnerability.
CVE-2024-35672 is a Missing Authorization vulnerability in Netgsm, affecting versions from an unspecified version through 2.9.19.

CVE-2024-3576 is a vulnerability affecting the NPort 5100A Series firmware version v1.6 and prior versions. It is characterized as a web server XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) vulnerability. The issue arises from not correctly neutralizing user-controllable input before placing it in output. This vulnerability could allow malicious users to obtain sensitive information and escalate privileges.

CVE-2024-36030 is a vulnerability in the Linux kernel, specifically concerning `octeontx2-af: fix the double free in rvu_npc_freemem()`. The issue was identified by a warning from the Clang static checker (scan-build) which pointed out an attempt to free already released memory at drivers/net/ethernet/marvell/octeontx2/af/rvu_npc.c, specifically at line 2184, column 2. The vulnerability arose due to the redundant `kfree()` function, leading to a double free problem for the `mcam->counters.bmap` resource that had already been released by `npc_mcam_rsrcs_deinit()`. The fix involved deleting this redundant `kfree()` operation.

CVE-2024-36076 is a vulnerability involving Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking in SysReptor from version 2024.28 to version 2024.30. This vulnerability allows attackers to escalate privileges and obtain sensitive information when a logged-in SysReptor user visits a malicious same-site subdomain in the same browser session.

CVE-2024-36427 is a vulnerability in the TARGIT Decision Suite before version 24.06.19002, which allows authenticated attackers to read or write to server files via a crafted file request. This can lead to code execution through a .xview file.
CVE-2024-36485 refers to a vulnerability in Zohocorp ManageEngine ADAudit Plus versions below 8121. These versions are susceptible to SQL Injection in the Technician reports option.

CVE-2024-3661 is a vulnerability in which DHCP can add routes to a client’s routing table via the classless static route option (121). VPN-based security solutions that rely on routes to redirect traffic can be forced to leak traffic over the physical interface. An attacker on the same local network can read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN.

CVE-2024-36611 is a reported security vulnerability in Symfony version 7.07, specifically in the FormLoginAuthenticator component. The vulnerability arises from the failure to adequately handle cases where the username or password field of a login request is empty. This flaw could potentially lead to various security risks, including improper authentication logic handling or denial of service. However, it is important to note that the supplier has concluded that this is a false report.
CVE-2024-36821 refers to a vulnerability involving insecure permissions in Linksys Velop WiFi 5 (WHW01v1) version 1.1.13.202617, which allows attackers to escalate privileges from Guest to root.

CVE-2024-36877 refers to a vulnerability discovered in Micro-Star International Z-series motherboards (Z590, Z490, and Z790) and B-series motherboards (B760, B560, B660, and B460) with firmware versions 7D25v14, 7D25v17 to 7D25v19, and 7D25v1A to 7D25v1H. The vulnerability is a write-what-where condition in the SW handler for SMI 0xE3, affecting motherboards with the following chipsets: Intel 300, Intel 400, Intel 500, Intel 600, Intel 700, AMD 300, AMD 400, AMD 500, AMD 600, and AMD 700.

CVE-2024-37094 is a Missing Authorization vulnerability in the StylemixThemes MasterStudy LMS, which allows exploitation due to incorrectly configured access control security levels. This vulnerability affects MasterStudy LMS from unspecified versions up to version 3.2.12.

CVE-2024-37107 is an Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in Membership Software WishList Member X, which allows for privilege escalation. This issue affects versions of WishList Member X before 3.26.7.
Based on the provided context, there is no information available about CVE-2024-37111.
CVE-2024-37222 is a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Averta Master Slider, which allows reflected XSS. This issue affects Master Slider from unspecified versions through 3.10.0.

CVE-2024-37224 refers to an Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in the SP Project & Document Manager, affecting versions from unknown through 4.71.

CVE-2024-37408 involves a security issue in fprintd through version 1.94.3, where it lacks a security attention mechanism. This issue may lead to unexpected actions being authorized by the use of "auth sufficient pam_fprintd.so" for Sudo. However, the supplier disputes this, asserting that resolving the issue would require modifying the PAM configuration to restrict pam_fprintd.so to front-ends with a proper attention mechanism, rather than modifying pam_fprintd.so or fprintd itself.

CVE-2024-3741 relates to a vulnerability in Electrolink transmitters, specifically an authentication bypass vulnerability affecting the login cookie. An attacker can set an arbitrary value, except 'NO', to the login cookie and gain full system access.

CVE-2024-3742 refers to a vulnerability in Electrolink transmitters where credentials are stored in clear-text. The misuse of these credentials could potentially allow an attacker to gain access to the system.
The context provided does not contain information on CVE-2024-3746.

CVE-2024-37742 is a vulnerability in Safe Exam Browser (SEB) version 3.5.0 on Windows. It involves insecure access control, allowing an attacker to share clipboard data between the SEB kiosk mode and the underlying system, potentially compromising exam integrity. By exploiting this flaw, an attacker can bypass exam controls and gain an unfair advantage during exams.

CVE-2024-37818 refers to a vulnerability discovered in Strapi v4.24.4, which contains a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) via the component /strapi.io/_next/image. This vulnerability allows attackers to scan for open ports or access sensitive information through a crafted GET request. However, the Strapi Development Community argues that this issue is not valid, stating that it does not pose a real SSRF risk to applications using the Strapi library.

CVE-2024-3798 is a vulnerability related to insecure handling of the GET header parameter file in requests sent to an instance of the open-source project Phoniebox. This vulnerability allows an attacker to create a webpage that, when visited by a user, can send malicious requests to multiple hosts on the local network. If such a request reaches the server, it may result in shell command execution, reflected XSS, or cross-site request forgery, depending on the payload used. This vulnerability affects all versions of Phoniebox through 2.7. Newer 2.x releases were not tested, but they might also be vulnerable. Phoniebox versions 3.0 and higher are not affected.

CVE-2024-3799 describes an issue with insecure handling of the POST header parameter body in requests sent to an instance of the open-source project Phoniebox. This vulnerability allows an attacker to create a malicious website, which, when visited by a user, sends harmful requests to multiple hosts on the local network. If such a request reaches the server, it results in shell command execution. The affected versions include all releases through 2.7, and while newer 2.x releases were not tested, they might also be vulnerable. Versions 3.0 and higher are not affected.

CVE-2024-37997 is a vulnerability identified in JT Open (All versions < V11.5), JT2Go (All versions < V2406.0003), PLM XML SDK (All versions < V7.1.0.014), Teamcenter Visualization V14.2 (All versions < V14.2.0.13), Teamcenter Visualization V14.3 (All versions < V14.3.0.11), Teamcenter Visualization V2312 (All versions < V2312.0008), and Teamcenter Visualization V2406 (All versions < V2406.0003). The affected applications have a stack-based overflow vulnerability when parsing specially crafted XML files, which could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.
CVE-2024-38021 refers to a Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
CVE-2024-38176 involves an improper restriction of excessive authentication attempts in GroupMe. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

CVE-2024-38202 is an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Update. It potentially enables an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of Virtualization Based Security (VBS). To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore, which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability. Microsoft has developed a security update to mitigate this threat, and further details are available in the Security Updates table of this CVE.

CVE-2024-38272 refers to a vulnerability in the Quick Share/Nearby feature, where an attacker can bypass the accept file dialog on Quick Share Windows. Normally, in the Quick Share Windows app, a file cannot be sent without the user's acceptance from the receiving device if the visibility is set to everyone mode or contacts mode. It is recommended to upgrade to version 1.0.1724.0 of Quick Share or above to address this vulnerability.

CVE-2024-38440 is a vulnerability in Netatalk 3.2.0, which involves an off-by-one error leading to a heap-based buffer overflow and segmentation violation. The issue arises from incorrectly using FPLoginExt in the BN_bin2bn function in the file etc/uams/uams_dhx_pam.c. This vulnerability is due to a lack of validation for the length field after parsing user-provided data, resulting in an out-of-bounds heap write of one byte. This can potentially cause a Denial of Service (DoS) under specific configurations, particularly with certain heap layouts or when ASAN is enabled.

CVE-2024-38472 is a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server on Windows. This vulnerability allows the potential leakage of NTLM hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue. Notably, existing configurations that access UNC paths will require configuring a new directive called "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

CVE-2024-38519 is a vulnerability in `yt-dlp` and `youtube-dl`, which are command-line audio/video downloaders. Prior to the fixed versions, these tools did not limit the extensions of downloaded files, potentially leading to arbitrary filenames being created in the download folder and path traversal on Windows. This could result in arbitrary code execution as these tools read config files from the working directory. The issue is fixed in `yt-dlp` version 2024.07.01 by whitelisting allowed extensions, and in `youtube-dl` through a specific commit (`d42a222`) and in nightly builds tagged 2024-07-03 or later. Users are advised to upgrade and follow best practices to mitigate the risk.

CVE-2024-3852 pertains to a vulnerability where GetBoundName could return the wrong version of an object when JIT optimizations were applied. This issue affects Firefox versions earlier than 125, Firefox ESR versions earlier than 115.10, and Thunderbird versions earlier than 115.10.

CVE-2024-3854 involves a vulnerability in which the Just-In-Time (JIT) compiler incorrectly optimizes switch statements, resulting in code that performs out-of-bounds reads. This vulnerability affects Mozilla Firefox versions prior to 125, Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.10, and Thunderbird versions prior to 115.10.

CVE-2024-3857 refers to a vulnerability in which the Just-In-Time (JIT) compiler created incorrect code for arguments in certain cases. This could lead to potential use-after-free crashes during garbage collection. The vulnerability affects Firefox versions below 125, Firefox ESR versions below 115.10, and Thunderbird versions below 115.10.

CVE-2024-3864 is a memory safety bug present in Firefox 124, Firefox ESR 115.9, and Thunderbird 115.9. This bug showed evidence of memory corruption, and it is presumed that with enough effort, it could be exploited to run arbitrary code. It affects Firefox versions less than 125, Firefox ESR versions less than 115.10, and Thunderbird versions less than 115.10.

CVE-2024-38649 is an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in IPsec of Ivanti Connect Secure, affecting versions before 22.7R2.1 (not applicable to 9.1Rx). This vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service.

CVE-2024-38788 is an "Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')" vulnerability in the UiPress lite component managed by Bởi Admin 2020. It allows SQL injection and affects UiPress lite versions up to 3.4.06.
The context provided does not contain information regarding CVE-2024-38867.

CVE-2024-38869 refers to a vulnerability affecting Zohocorp ManageEngine Endpoint Central, specifically due to incorrect authorization in remote office deploy configurations. This issue impacts Endpoint Central versions prior to 11.3.2416.04 and 11.3.2400.25.

CVE-2024-38876 is a vulnerability identified in various components of the Omnivise T3000, including the Application Server R9.2, Domain Controller R9.2, Product Data Management (PDM) R9.2, R8.2 SP3, R8.2 SP4, Terminal Server R9.2, Thin Client R9.2, and Whitelisting Server R9.2. The vulnerability involves the application regularly executing user-modifiable code as a privileged user, which could allow a local authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

CVE-2024-38877 is a vulnerability identified in several versions of Omnivise T3000 systems, including the Application Server, Domain Controller, Security Server, Terminal Server, Thin Client, Whitelisting Server, Network Intrusion Detection System, and Product Data Management, specifically versions R9.2 and R8.2 SP3 and SP4. The vulnerability occurs because these devices store initial system credentials without sufficient protection. An attacker with remote shell access or physical access could retrieve these credentials, leading to a confidentiality loss and allowing the attacker to move laterally within the affected network.

CVE-2024-38878 is a vulnerability identified in Omnivise T3000 Application Server R9.2 (All versions), Omnivise T3000 R8.2 SP3 (All versions), and Omnivise T3000 R8.2 SP4 (All versions). This vulnerability affects devices by allowing authenticated users to export diagnostics data. The corresponding API endpoint is susceptible to path traversal, which could allow an authenticated attacker to download arbitrary files from the file system.

CVE-2024-38879 is a vulnerability identified in Omnivise T3000 Application Server R9.2 (all versions), Omnivise T3000 R8.2 SP3 (all versions), and Omnivise T3000 R8.2 SP4 (all versions). The affected system exposes the port of an internal application on the public network interface, allowing an attacker to circumvent authentication and directly access the exposed application.

CVE-2024-39249 refers to a vulnerability in Async versions <= 2.6.4 and <= 3.2.5, which are susceptible to ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service) while parsing in the autoinject function. However, this issue is disputed by the supplier because they argue that there is no realistic threat model since regular expressions are not used with untrusted input.

CVE-2024-39340 is a vulnerability in the authentication system of Securepoint UTM that mishandles OTP (One-Time Password) keys. This mishandling allows for the bypassing of the second-factor verification (when OTP is enabled) both in the administration web interface and the user portal. The affected versions include UTM 11.5 through 12.6.4 and Reseller Preview 12.7.0. The issue has been fixed in UTM versions 12.6.5 and 12.7.1.

CVE-2024-39345 refers to a vulnerability in AdTran 834-5 HDC17600021F1 (SmartOS 11.1.1.1) devices. The vulnerability arises from the SSH service being enabled by default and the presence of a hidden, undocumented, hard-coded support account with a password based on the device's MAC address. Because all internet interfaces of the devices share a similar MAC address that only varies in the final octet, network-adjacent attackers can derive the support user's SSH password by decrementing the final octet of the connected gateway address or via the BSSID. This vulnerability potentially allows an attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands with root-level privileges. The vendor has stated that this issue was fixed in SmartOS 12.5.5.1 and claims there is no intended functionality for attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands with root-level privileges.

CVE-2024-39420 is a Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability affecting Acrobat Reader versions 20.005.30636, 24.002.21005, 24.001.30159, 20.005.30655, 24.002.20965, 24.002.20964, 24.001.30123, 24.003.20054, and earlier. This vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution. It arises from changes in the timing of actions that alter the state of a resource between the checking of a condition and the use of the resource, allowing an attacker to manipulate the resource in a harmful way. Exploiting this issue requires user interaction, where a victim must open a malicious file.

CVE-2024-39516 is an Out-of-Bounds Read vulnerability in the routing protocol daemon (rpd) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated network-based attacker to send a specifically malformed BGP packet, causing the rpd to crash and restart, resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS). The issue creates a sustained DoS condition upon continued receipt and processing of the malicious packet. It affects systems configured with BGP traceoptions enabled or with BGP traffic engineering configured. This vulnerability can impact both iBGP and eBGP with any address family configured, although the specific attribute involved is non-transitive and will not propagate across a network. Affected versions include all Junos OS versions before 21.4R3-S8, 22.2 before 22.2R3-S5, 22.3 before 22.3R3-S4, 22.4 before 22.4R3-S3, 23.2 before 23.2R2-S2, and 23.4 before 23.4R2; similarly, all Junos OS Evolved versions before 21.4R3-S8-EVO, 22.2-EVO before 22.2R3-S5-EVO, 22.3-EVO before 22.3R3-S4-EVO, 22.4-EVO before 22.4R3-S3-EVO, 23.2-EVO before 23.2R2-S2-EVO, and 23.4-EVO before 23.4R2-EVO.

CVE-2024-39549 is a Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime vulnerability in the routing process daemon (rpd) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. It allows an attacker to send a malformed BGP Path attribute update which allocates memory used to log the bad path attribute. This memory is not properly freed in all circumstances, leading to a Denial of Service (DoS). Memory can be freed by manually restarting the Routing Protocol Daemon (rpd). This issue affects various versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved.

CVE-2024-39550 refers to a "Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime" vulnerability in the rtlogd process of Juniper Networks Junos OS on MX Series with SPC3. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to trigger internal events (which can happen through repeated port flaps) to cause a slow memory leak, ultimately leading to a Denial of Service (DoS). Memory can only be recovered by manually restarting the rtlogd process. The affected versions include Junos OS on MX Series with SPC3 line cards from versions 21.2R3 before 21.2R3-S8, 21.4R2 before 21.4R3-S6, 22.1 before 22.1R3-S5, 22.2 before 22.2R3-S3, 22.3 before 22.3R3-S2, 22.4 before 22.4R3-S1, 23.2 before 23.2R2, and 23.4 before 23.4R2.

CVE-2024-39551 is an Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in the H.323 ALG (Application Layer Gateway) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series and MX Series with SPC3 and MS-MPC/MIC. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated network-based attacker to send specific packets that cause traffic loss leading to a Denial of Service (DoS). Continued receipt and processing of these specific packets will sustain the Denial of Service condition. This issue affects SRX Series and MX Series with SPC3 and MS-MPC/MIC on specific versions of the software.

CVE-2024-39558 is an Unchecked Return Value vulnerability in the Routing Protocol Daemon (rpd) on Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows a logically adjacent, unauthenticated attacker to send a specific PIM packet, causing the rpd to crash and restart, resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS) when PIM is configured with Multicast-only Fast Reroute (MoFRR). Continued receipt and processing of this packet could create a sustained DoS condition. The issue is observed on Junos and Junos Evolved platforms where PIM is configured along with MoFRR. This affects various versions before certain specified releases of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved.

CVE-2024-39560 is an Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the routing protocol daemon (rpd) of Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. This vulnerability allows a logically adjacent downstream RSVP neighbor to cause kernel memory exhaustion, leading to a kernel crash and resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS). The issue occurs when the downstream RSVP neighbor has a persistent error that is not corrected. The vulnerability affects various versions of Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved, as specified in the document.

CVE-2024-39709 refers to a vulnerability involving incorrect file permissions in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.6R2 (Not Applicable to 9.1Rx) and Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1 (Not Applicable to 9.1Rx). This vulnerability allows a local authenticated attacker to escalate their privileges.

CVE-2024-39755 is a privilege escalation vulnerability in the node update functionality of Veertu Anka Build 1.42.0. This vulnerability allows an attacker to execute privileged operations by making an unauthenticated HTTP request, leveraging a specially crafted PKG file.

CVE-2024-3980 is a vulnerability in the MicroSCADA Pro/X SYS600 product that allows an authenticated user to control or influence paths or file names used in filesystem operations. If exploited, this vulnerability enables the attacker to access or modify system files or other critical application files.

CVE-2024-4030 is a vulnerability on Windows where a directory returned by `tempfile.mkdtemp()` would not always have permissions set to restrict reading and writing by other users. This issue was caused by Python not supporting Unix permissions on Windows, leading to alternate configurations or users without a profile directory potentially not having the intended permissions. The fix involves adding support for Unix "700" permissions for the `mkdir` function on Windows, which is used by `mkdtemp()`, ensuring the newly created directory has the proper permissions. If you are not using Windows or haven't changed the temporary directory location, this vulnerability does not affect you.

CVE-2024-40420 is a rejected CVE record because it is a duplicate of CVE-2024-36694. All CVE users should reference CVE-2024-36694 instead of CVE-2024-40420, and all references and descriptions in the CVE-2024-40420 record have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

CVE-2024-40531 is a mass assignment vulnerability in Pantera CRM versions 401.152 and 402.072. This flaw allows authenticated users to modify any user attribute, including roles, by injecting additional parameters via profile management functions.

CVE-2024-4056 refers to a denial of service condition in M-Files Server in versions before 24.4.13592.4 and after 23.11 (excluding 24.2 LTS). This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated user to consume computing resources on the affected systems.

CVE-2024-4068 refers to a vulnerability in the NPM package `braces`, in versions prior to 3.0.3. This vulnerability causes the package to fail to limit the number of characters it can handle, potentially leading to memory exhaustion. Specifically, in `lib/parse.js`, if a malicious user inputs "imbalanced braces", the parsing enters a loop, causing the program to allocate heap memory without releasing it during the loop. This eventually leads to the JavaScript heap limit being reached and the program crashing.

CVE-2024-41118 refers to a vulnerability in the streamlit-geospatial application, which is a Streamlit multipage app used for geospatial applications. The issue, occurring before commit c4f81d9616d40c60584e36abb15300853a66e489, involves the `url` variable on line 47 of `pages/7_📦_Web_Map_Service.py` taking user input that is subsequently passed to the `get_layers` function. This input is used with the `get_wms_layer` method, resulting in a blind server-side request forgery vulnerability due to requests potentially being sent to arbitrary destinations. The mentioned commit resolves this security issue.

CVE-2024-41163 is a directory traversal vulnerability in the archive functionality of Veertu Anka Build 1.42.0. The vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker through a specially crafted HTTP request, potentially leading to the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2024-41226 is a CSV injection vulnerability in Automation Anywhere Automation 360 version 21094 that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted payload. However, Automation Anywhere disputes this report, contending that the attacker executes everything from the client side and does not attack the Control Room. They argue that the payload is injected in the HTTP response from the client-side, and the owner of the response and payload is the end user. Therefore, they suggest that the server's security controls have no impact or role in this situation, deeming it not a valid vulnerability.

CVE-2024-41605 is a vulnerability in Foxit PDF Reader before version 2024.3, and PDF Editor before version 2024.3 and 13.x before 13.1.4. An attacker can replace an update file with a Trojan horse via side loading because the update service lacks integrity validation for the updater. This allows attacker-controlled code to be executed.

CVE-2024-41659 refers to a vulnerability found in memos, a privacy-first, lightweight note-taking service. The issue is a CORS misconfiguration in memos version 0.20.1 and earlier, where an arbitrary origin is reflected with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials set to true. This misconfiguration may allow an attacking website to make a cross-origin request, which could enable the attacker to read private information or make privileged changes to the system as the vulnerable user account. This vulnerability is fixed in version 0.21.0.

CVE-2024-41667 is a vulnerability in OpenAM, an open access management solution. In versions 15.0.3 and prior, the `getCustomLoginUrlTemplate` method in `RealmOAuth2ProviderSettings.java` is vulnerable to template injection due to its usage of user input. The developer intended to implement a custom URL for handling login to override the default OpenAM login but did not restrict the `CustomLoginUrlTemplate`, allowing it to be set freely. A fix has been introduced with commit `fcb8432aa77d5b2e147624fe954cb150c568e0b8`, which implements `TemplateClassResolver.SAFER_RESOLVER` to disable the resolution of commonly exploited classes in FreeMarker template injection. This fix is expected to be part of version 15.0.4.

CVE-2024-4173 is a vulnerability in Brocade SANnav that exposes Kafka in the WAN interface. It could allow an unauthenticated attacker to perform various attacks, including a Denial of Service (DOS) against the Brocade SANnav.

CVE-2024-41856 is an Improper Input Validation vulnerability affecting Illustrator versions 28.5, 27.9.4, 28.6, 27.9.5, and earlier. This vulnerability could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation requires user interaction, specifically that a victim opens a malicious file.

CVE-2024-41922 is a directory traversal vulnerability in the log files download functionality of Veertu Anka Build 1.42.0. It can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker through a specially crafted HTTP request, leading to the potential disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2024-41981 is a vulnerability identified in Simcenter Femap V2306, V2401, and V2406, which are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow while parsing specially crafted BDF files. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.

CVE-2024-43689 is a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in ELECOM wireless access points. By processing a specially crafted HTTP request, arbitrary code may be executed.

CVE-2024-44030 is an "Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')" vulnerability in Mestres do WP Checkout Mestres WP. This vulnerability allows PHP Local File Inclusion and affects Checkout Mestres WP versions from unspecified versions through 8.6.

CVE-2024-44061 is an Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS) vulnerability in WPFactory EU/UK VAT Manager for WooCommerce, which allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). This issue affects the EU/UK VAT Manager for WooCommerce from an unspecified version through 2.12.14.

CVE-2024-44100 pertains to a vulnerability in Android versions released before 2024-10-05, specifically on Google Pixel devices. This vulnerability allows information disclosure in the modem component, identified as issue A-299774545.

CVE-2024-44259 is a vulnerability where an attacker may be able to misuse a trust relationship to download malicious content. This issue was addressed through improved state management and is fixed in iOS 17.7.1 and iPadOS 17.7.1, visionOS 2.1, iOS 18.1 and iPadOS 18.1, macOS Sequoia 15.1, and Safari 18.1.

CVE-2024-44400 is a vulnerability discovered in DI_8400-16.07.26A1, classified as critical. It affects the `upgrade_filter_asp` function in the `upgrade_filter.asp` file. The issue involves manipulation of the path parameter, which can lead to command injection.
CVE-2024-44815 is a vulnerability in the Hathway Skyworth Router CM5100 version 4.1.1.24. It allows a physically proximate attacker to obtain user credentials via SPI flash Firmware W25Q64JV.

CVE-2024-45058 is a vulnerability in i-Educar, which is a free, fully online school management software used by school secretaries, teachers, coordinators, and area managers. Before the 2.9 branch, an attacker with minimal viewing privileges in the settings section could change their user type to Administrator (or another type with super-permissions) through a specifically crafted POST request to `/intranet/educar_usuario_cad.php`, by modifying the `nivel_usuario_` parameter. The issue arises because the file located at `ieducar/intranet/educar_usuario_cad.php` does not check the user's current permission level before allowing changes. The issue is patched in commit c25910cdf11ab50e50162a49dd44bef544422b6e.

CVE-2024-45059 is a SQL Injection vulnerability found in the i-Educar school management software. The vulnerability existed in the `ieducar/intranet/funcionario_vinculo_det.php` file, affecting versions prior to the 2.9 branch. It allowed an attacker to obtain sensitive information such as emails and password hashes by exploiting the unsanitized GET parameter `cod_func`. The issue was fixed with commit 7824b95745fa2da6476b9901041d9c854bf52ffe.

CVE-2024-45346 is a code execution vulnerability that exists in the XiaomiGetApps application product. This vulnerability is caused by the verification logic being bypassed, allowing an attacker to exploit it to execute malicious code.

CVE-2024-45394 is a vulnerability in the Authenticator browser extension, which generates two-step verification codes. In versions 7.0.0 and below, encryption keys for user data were stored encrypted at-rest using only AES-256 and the EVP_BytesToKey Key Derivation Function (KDF). This allows attackers with a copy of a user's data to brute-force the user's encryption key. Users on version 8.0.0 and above are automatically migrated away from this weak encoding on the first login, and it is recommended that users destroy encrypted backups made with versions prior to 8.0.0.
